content:
Posted: January 28, 2015
												This is a darn cotton pick'n good game. The learning curve is steep as there are not really any complete instructions. Its a lot of testing out things. There are a few things that are in game but are presently useless until the next update. However, this game is sick. I get to pirate pixels with out breaking copyright laws!Basically you start out answering a series of questions which tailor your game experience, which are questions about your past and the world around you. You must plunder or take a prize from pirates around your skill level or less unless your up for some random chance at glory and risk dying a bloody ugly death. As you train your mates, it seems that the trick is stacking early intelligence on about 5 pirates, outfitting them with jobs from your home island. No starter pirate seems to know how to clean his own crap up much less do anything worth while like fish, you have to LEARN em good. That costs money. You can train pets, when your attacked they will defend you if your boarded. Its actually really addicting, though I am reaching my limit and at this point the replay value would only be upped by new features.

content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												One of the worst games I have ever played. First thing is sound, There is only 3 diffrent crew voices. Normally this wouldn't bother me except for the fact that your crew never shuts up. You either have Satin 1, Satin 2 or Chipmunks. Another thing is that your crew is ALWAYS talking to each other both outloud and a chat bar over their heads. The reason I hate the chat bar is because 90% of the things they say are from Pirates Of The Carribbean and the rest of it is stuff like "your my favorite pirate" and "next drink is on me" and "let's plunder". Second thing is how stereotypical this game is. Remember when you were in like 4th grade learning about pirates but they never talked about the graphic stuff? That's what this game is, except for when someone dies and ther torso goes flying 10 feet away with a crappy trail of blood in one of the most unrealistic ways I have ever seen in a game. It seems like the only things the Devs know about pirates comes from Pirates Of The Carribbean and learning about them in fourth grade. Most people buy this game because they think it's a Pirate version of Terrarria, it's not that at all. I don't want to be too harsh but I also want to tell you not to buy this game.

content:
Posted: February 21, 2014
Early Access Review
								First impressions: http://www.cublikefoot.com/pixel-piracy-first-impressions/Yes, a pirate simulator. Pixel Piracy is a pirate simulator. Now, who wouldn’t want to try out a pirate simulator?It may sound fun, but it is really, really hard. The game also has permadeath, which just adds to the fun, well, if you’re good at the game at least. You’ll need to start by building a ship and, optionally, hiring a someone to be on your crew. The crew system is a bit annoying, because oftentimes the crew will just ignore your orders because they lack loyalty. Loyalty can be gained by paying them in gold, the game’s currency.The game’s shipbuilding is a bit weird. My first ship looked like a block, but it still worked. In fact, all of the early game enemies also had terrible-looking ships, just like mine. Later in the game, you’ll get to build cooler ships, assuming you don’t die along the way. I’ve yet to get far enough to build a really fancy ship, so I’ll just stick with my floating blocks of wood for now. Pixel Piracy also has an RPG element to go along with it. It’s rather complex, but adds a lot to the game and I really enjoy its addition.Early-game, I had a lot of trouble with combat. I was terrible at it. The combat is really unpredictable, there is little to no indication of whether or not you will win a fight. With more crewmates, however, the chances of winning in combat rise immensely, especially when you’ve got six or so guys and they got three. The combat could be better, but the game is in early access, so changes could be made along the way.Although the game is difficult, I find enjoyment in it anyways. I’ll get better at it as I play, for sure.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
												I`m going to be straight to the point. Pros: +Its Made by Re-Logic which means IT NEVER STOPS GETTING BETTER!+Some Call this game repetitive but to me with all these new updates theres so much to do!+You can make your own adventure. Its never quite the same!: -Picking what your dad was-Killing everyone in the tavern and then never coming back!-Crew not knowing how to just take a dump off the side of the ship -And much much more!?!+Player  Customization +Good Graphics +So many more things that words can`t describeCons:-Pirates Having a bad Ai {I`m sure it will be fixed!}Now i have just one con but that is because there is not anything bad to say about the game. Everything that was bad has been fixed and little bugs just make the game even more worth while. People can come and go saying that this game is "un finished" or "a grindy game" but to me its all for the laughs. I named my pirates after a kid shows called Jake and the Neverland Pirates. Which just made the game a whole lot more fun. I can keep making files of this game and will never end. So to finish it off just to seal the deal its made by Re-Logic. Terraria started off slow and now look at it. I stopped playing it for a week and over 1000+ items were added! It just comes to show this game just keeps getting better!

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 4, 2015
												THIS GAME IS NOT AS BAD AS PEOPLE SAY!!!...  Sorry I just had to get that out there. Pixel Piracy is not a horrible game, and it certainly is not abandon because they released a update on the 30th of march! The game features no totorial other that the basic controls, this does NOT help the game because people start the game, get lost in its frustrating overly-complex menus and ui, then quit and uninstall it. But if you can get passed that and learn what to do and how to properly play the game, you will have fun. Aside from that the game is buggy but the devs are working on that, so cut them some slack, if it is still super buggy after the enhanced edition is released then there is a problem. To sum things up the game was released way too early, its very hard to start off unless you look stuff up online and read the F1 help menu and it needs a little more work. But if you are looking for a fun Rougelite with pirate theme then this is what you want. I have enjoyed  this game every minute I sank in, and it is worth it if you want a RPG Pirate game.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
												In Pixel Piracy you play the role of a dashing pirate of your own make. You can choose parts of your history, but what it really comes down to is your infinite hatred for poop. Left on his/her own with a boat in a land where everyone has been cursed to poop at any given moment for no reason and no matter where they are, it is up to you to establish the greatest poop cleaning ship in all the land.Our hero must go to great lengths to train his/her crew in the art of poop cleaning or even improving their skill at controlling their poop. Aside from the awesome storyline, the player is left with a lot of moral decisions like, do you go all genocide on the natives on some island just in case there might be a cleaning training book on the island? Do you attack the boat that is minding it's own business for the same reason plus a chance at taking a ship that might have more space for poop clearing facilities?If taking ships doesn't shiver your timbers, you can also build your ship up to your liking. There's a lot of value in building the ultimate ship for combatting the poop menace.All of that aside, here are some other miscellaneous features of the game that haven't been discussed above:-Have your crew poop on the enemy ship!-Watch your crew poop mid-combat!-Hire awesome warriors to defend your poop cleaning guys. (The latter are the real heros)-Defeat four major pirate bosses to distract yourself from the real war. (Talking about the war on poop)-Keep the poopdeck clean, have your men and women wear diapers!-Bras increase morale!-Mount cannons and swivel guns onto your ship and shoot at stuff! (Mounted weapons can't shoot poop though)-Be a badass!-Ignore the war on poop and watch morale drop like poop in a vacuum!-Pirate stuff! (Not really a major feature, it's more about the poop) -Scurvy!10/10 Would die of scurvy aboard a shop covered in poop again.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2016
												Devs seemed to have abandoned it, however the below is my review of the game before I was disappointed.I haven't played too much but it is fun. It does get really hard to manage late game with a big crew and all of them pooping and eating and costing you money while you still have to manage their weapons and consumables and abilities individually. Early on though, that's where the real fun is. Set off with yer manageable crew and kill manageable pirates whith crewmembers you actually value because you've invested so much in them, only to have them drown because they were stabbed while ziplining over to the enemy ship. Very sad times... but very fun times too. It's like an RPG but also a real time strategy but also a sandbox but also a cry your eyes out when your captain doesn't know how to swim and gets knocked into the water.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 2, 2015
												I got this game from the Humble Bundle so I cant complain, however, I am going to. I started up the game and a small pirate started screaming at me. I did not know how to please the pirate and stop it's whining so I sat there in confusion as my ear drums shattered. I cleaned the blood from my ears and thought, hey, lets give it another go. I made a pirate and answered some questions and then I was on an island. From here I could click things and talk to pirates. However, as I became deaf I could only read the 50mph subtitles which gave me eye strain. I persevered to find that I was meant to attack another pirate ship, so, after 10 minutes of confusion I found my ship. From here I could not do anything but get pooed on by several seaguls and I got two achievements for this. At this point I was physically trembling, a seizure had set in and my limbs were not my own. The last thing I remebered was waking up in a hospital. When I awoke I was told by a doctor I had every single STD and 3 months to live, (I think I was anyway because I have bad tinitus from the screaming pirate), so I took the time to warn others of this. Overall 4/10, got me out the house

content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												One of the worst games I have ever played. First thing is sound, There is only 3 diffrent crew voices. Normally this wouldn't bother me except for the fact that your crew never shuts up. You either have Satin 1, Satin 2 or Chipmunks. Another thing is that your crew is ALWAYS talking to each other both outloud and a chat bar over their heads. The reason I hate the chat bar is because 90% of the things they say are from Pirates Of The Carribbean and the rest of it is stuff like "your my favorite pirate" and "next drink is on me" and "let's plunder". Second thing is how stereotypical this game is. Remember when you were in like 4th grade learning about pirates but they never talked about the graphic stuff? That's what this game is, except for when someone dies and ther torso goes flying 10 feet away with a crappy trail of blood in one of the most unrealistic ways I have ever seen in a game. It seems like the only things the Devs know about pirates comes from Pirates Of The Carribbean and learning about them in fourth grade. Most people buy this game because they think it's a Pirate version of Terrarria, it's not that at all. I don't want to be too harsh but I also want to tell you not to buy this game.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 28, 2015
												This is a darn cotton pick'n good game. The learning curve is steep as there are not really any complete instructions. Its a lot of testing out things. There are a few things that are in game but are presently useless until the next update. However, this game is sick. I get to pirate pixels with out breaking copyright laws!Basically you start out answering a series of questions which tailor your game experience, which are questions about your past and the world around you. You must plunder or take a prize from pirates around your skill level or less unless your up for some random chance at glory and risk dying a bloody ugly death. As you train your mates, it seems that the trick is stacking early intelligence on about 5 pirates, outfitting them with jobs from your home island. No starter pirate seems to know how to clean his own crap up much less do anything worth while like fish, you have to LEARN em good. That costs money. You can train pets, when your attacked they will defend you if your boarded. Its actually really addicting, though I am reaching my limit and at this point the replay value would only be upped by new features.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												A cute idea hampered by horrible implementation and a startling lack of polish all combine into an awful game. Let's take it apart, piece by piece-Graphics(3/10)- Obviously one of the first things you'll notice about the game, Pixel Piracy falls pretty flat here. First off, the entire game is smothered in a layer of bloom that adjusting the game's graphics settings seems to do nothing to lessen. I'm fairly certain there are only two backgrounds in the entire game, one for land, and one for sea, and neither are very interesting. And while there's not really anything wrong with the actual visual game elements, it looks like the sort of pixel style that is not done to deliberately invoke a retro or indie feel, but one that comes of a developer who is either very lazy or very short on funds. The characters are ugly, the items are unrecognizable, and the game world is just incredibly samey. So, in short, while it's not physically painful to look at, that's really the best I can say of it, and even that's not true sometimes.Sound(1/10)- Jesus god in heaven help me. If you can play this for more than a minute with the sound on, you are a stronger person than I will ever be. The game's bgm consists of 4, maybe five, tracks that are nothing but 30-45 second loops of the most utterly uninspired MIDI music you can imagine. Incredibly, that's the good part of the sound design, because all the effects are even worse. The general game sound effects are repetitive and aggravating, but they pale in comparison to the game's voice clips. Every different character in this game is assigned one of an astoundingly large number of 2 second clips of what I can only assume are people the devs pulled off the street to read Klingon backwards into 50 year old microphones. And the game is really proud of them, so it plays one for you every time ANYTHING happens, which equates to about 6000 times on every single sailing voyage you take. Maybe that's not enough for you? How about "sea shanties"? By which I mean another awful MIDI track under a tinny voice that makes me want to poke my eardrums out crooning some hilariously cringeworthy g-rated pirate themed lyrics. Because that's what this game has to offer. You get the picture. I hope you get the picture. Please don't make me talk about the game's sound anymore.Story(Not even really applicable/10)- There isn't any. That's it. Probaby better that way, to be honest. Moving on.Gameplay(2/10)- This section is depressingly similar to the last one. The "gameplay" can really be divided into three categories: preparing to do stuff, doing stuff, and waiting for the stuff you've done to happen. The preparing to do stuff is probably where you'll spend a majority of the game. This accounts for all time spent in shops and menus and stat screens. this is where you hire crew members and buy weapons and upgrade your ship and teach your crew how to poop properly (no, really). This is the closest the game the game comes to being fun, but it would come a lot closer if any of this crap I've mentioned ACTUALLY WORKED. This game legitmately has the least intuitive and most perplexing UI I've ever encountered. Equipment screens are confusing, skills are absurd, and whoever thought doing 90% of all in-game actions from a pause screen was a good idea really oughta be killed. But once you've emerged from the menu maze you get the tremendous pleasure of ...*wait for it*... clicking. That's it. That's all you really get to do. You click. To attack or to move or to dig or to plunder, you click. Once. Maybe twice. And then you wait. Absolutely NOTHING in this game is in a hurry. Sailing is slow, your crew moves slow, scroling the camera is slow. And then, once you're done waiting, head back to the menus. I am in no way exaggerating when I say that's all there is to the game. That's literally it. And don't think for a second that there are a variety of environements to explore. You've got your towns, your deserted islands, your open sea, and your ship battles. Once again, no exaggeration. That's it. And I'm really not kidding about this game's bizarre obsession with poop. There are a myriad of skills, items, and acheivements relating to fecal matter. Kind fitting really.So, wouldn't it be nice to have a game where you could design your own captain and build your own ship and mold your own crew and sail the open seas to find treaure, love, and destiny? You better believe it would. Is that game Pixel Piracy? No. No it is not.2/10, incredibly disappointing, do not purchase.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												Perhaps one of the most boring, and unprofessional games I have ever played.  If you're having trouble falling asleep at night and don't own Unepic, buy this game and play some pixel piracy.  It sure puts me to sleep.Edit: 2015, July 20th.   I've tried once again to get into the game and see what's what in it, and I've encountered numerous bugs; all of which have been reported and have had devs reply to; most of which back in 2014.  The devs seemed to have a tendency of replying once saying something along the lines of: "It is working", then never getting back to the poster when they say it's not working.  And now they're releasing a sequel to the game with the same concept except in space, someone earlier called the game a scam; and I am starting to agree with that sentiment.There is no animating done, at all in the game.  I'm not an animation expert myself but I can at least make a walk, talk, and attack animations in only a few hours; the extent of noticable animation you'll get in Pixel piracy is your character moving slightly.Then there's the voice system; all the voices feel like the devs asked some random kids "Hey; say something piratey"; and it really gets annoying after a while of them just saying the same things over and over again.  The character traits and professions seem to be completely pointless and serve as just eyecandy; the type of world seems to have no real effect on things, the interface doesn't work very properly and you'll occasionally get a blank screen forcing you to restart the game.Overall I'd say this game is probably worth a dollar on the android market; but does not belong on any sort of Windows store, let alone for the price they're asking for.  And I still agree with my original thought all that time back;  this is perhaps one of the most boring, unprofessional games I've ever seen.  The formula is simply: Go to random square, either land on island, shop, or combat.  If you land on island, reopen map and go to another square, if you land on shop, see about getting new units, or upgrading them, if you land on combat, left and right click enemy ship, wait, then left/right click your ship, wait, and click plunder button; and repeat.  Oh, i also forgot to mention all the waiting between each block while your ship is "sailing".It's funny, I bought this game on April 1st from a bundle for a dollar; it sort of feels like a joke of them to even have it.  I rate this game a 2/10; it is a waste of time, it's not good, it's not awefull, it's just a black whole sucking in all the potential entertainment you could have watching paint dry instead.

It's a shame as the game has a charm about it but it's too flabby and overweight. I often judge games by how much "fun" time there is per "play" time. This one actually decreases as you play :-(Trying to palm off a Alpha build as a full 1.0 retail... Appalling.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2015
												The premise was promising: Terraria meets Sid Meier's Pirates, what could possibly go wrong?Well, a lot apparently.Right off the bat, the first problem I have is that I have no flipping clue what I'm doing. Nevermind all the arrs, the "tutorial" is hardly useful besides keeping you from dying before you even set sail. The interface is never explained in any notable detail, and the interface itself is unintuitive and badly designed. I still don't know how I'm supposed to save the game, even though the Exit Game button reminds me to, besides clicking that Exit Game button to force an autosave.The gameplay is also really really lacking. The premise of Terraria? No, not really. It's far better to capture better ships than to build your own, and unlike Terraria the interface just doesn't stimulate creativity. But what about the pirating, you ask? Nah, it's basically get some levels in the earlygame and then you're set; just tank the enemy ship if cannons are present and then just board with everyone and just win with sheer numbers. Same for islands, just with no cannons.Overall very disappointed. Was it worth the $1.49 I paid for because this was on sale? Maybe, I did spend a little under 5 hours on it. 32 cents per hour of entertainment? Meh, at least I didn't lose much.TL;DR: Boring, bad interface, only go for it if it's on sale and you are really interested.

												As soon as I saw the developer's name, I SHOULD have thought twice about buying this game but I loved the idea so much I bought it anyway when it first came out.Basically, the game has not changed since launch and by change I mean "it hasn't been completed." ... Just like all his other games. It's a great tech demo in a long line of tech demos that never get finished. There's plenty of balance issues, the UI breaks down as you try and keep up with the non-stop micromanagement. You can die for completely B.S. reasons (bugs) and lose everything. Worst of all, the game just stops being fun after the novelty wears off. He never added anything more to do. Your experience never grows. The first 30 minutes of gameplay is the same as the last 30 minutes of gameplay as you become so bored and frustated you just stop playing.This is the last time I give this guy money. I've learned my lesson.

content:
Posted: May 13, 2014
Early Access Review
This review is for version 0.6.5 BETAPixel Piracy holds much potential, that's what I wanted to say first. However, the game is currently in beta and it is far from completed. The interface is rather confusing and there are game-breaking bugs which only a restart and reload of an old save will solve. The game balance is very off, especially when the AI can easily be defeated by a single person. You can beat an army of enemies with just your captain by  pausing the game and use the move&attack button on an enemy. The AI will stop doing whatever they were doing for a short while after you issued the command. In this way, you can hit an enemy, pause the game, give a new order and watch your captain slaughter all enemies without them fighting back. There are several other annoyances, such as missing scroll bars if you collected many items, and the weird interface for your crew, as well as poop. So much poop on your ship! Pirates need to eliminate from time to time and will do so on your ship. You can teach your people to clean, but for some reason, the cleaning rate is lower than pooping rate, so you will end up having a ship full of poop.Nevertheless, I can not only list the bad stuff, can I? I love the art/graphic style. It's simple, yes, but it's very beautiful. I also like the sound and the smooth animations and transitions of the interface. The game's core concept is great, I want to play this, just explore one more island and fight one more legendary boss. But right now, there is little to be explored. I hope they will add much content (or modding support?). All in all, I had and still have fun with this game, even in the current state, so I can recommend this game to people who want to support the developers and can take a peek into the game, but not to people who want to have a finished game.

content:

Early Access Review
								Pixel Piracy...It can be super annoying sometimes to get to an amazingly easy to defeat island, when all of a sudden your highest leveled character decides he doesn't know how to use a rope and falls into the ocean. But that's all part of this game. It's the most fun I've ever had on a roguelike game, and that's not usually something I say about the genre. It could be because this one is a lot more forgiving than other games like it as it has a save feature before traveling. While this game is still in developement, I still really enjoy all of the current aspects of it, and look forward to seeing what comes in the future.7/10 which is damn good for a game in alpha.

content:
Posted: January 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								Pixel Piracy is a pretty fun little game that is sure to entertain you for a few hours at least. While it could use some more polish and some of the interfacing could be a little better, it is not a complete game. You can build a pirate ship, starting from a few free blocks, and basically it's a pirate sim from there. Start from boarding other small crafts to shooting cannons from your gigantic ship. There is a few things to keep track of though and time management is also a factor. It's really a hard game and you will surely lose a lot when you first start but you learn what to do different every time. After it's updated, I'm sure I will be able to say that Pixel Piracy is one of my favorite indie games out there.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14, 2014
Early Access Review
								I very much enjoy this game and definitely recommend it to anyone! Especially if you enjoy Pirates or Rogue-likes or both.The developers are constantly updating the game with new content and fixing bugs and the community on steam is awesome!So pull up a chair and get ready to plunder ships and get awesome loot! If you are having a hard time just visit us in the community page and look at guides videos and more I'm sure you will find what you need and remember "Dead men tell no tales!"Things to point out about Pixel Piracy:1. It is in early alpha. There will be balance issues and bugs! The developers are working very hard on fixing the issues. (More than you can say for some games.)2. This game is very addicting. Even when you die and lose all your progress in hardcore mode you just want to make a new pirate and try again!.3. A new princess mode is now available to play. When you die you can reload your last save.4. an amazing amount of content has been released so far and i am sure more will come!5. Don't let the fact that this game is in alpha bother you take it with a grain of salt report your issues in the community page so everyone benefits and keep on playing!

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2015
												The premise was promising: Terraria meets Sid Meier's Pirates, what could possibly go wrong?Well, a lot apparently.Right off the bat, the first problem I have is that I have no flipping clue what I'm doing. Nevermind all the arrs, the "tutorial" is hardly useful besides keeping you from dying before you even set sail. The interface is never explained in any notable detail, and the interface itself is unintuitive and badly designed. I still don't know how I'm supposed to save the game, even though the Exit Game button reminds me to, besides clicking that Exit Game button to force an autosave.The gameplay is also really really lacking. The premise of Terraria? No, not really. It's far better to capture better ships than to build your own, and unlike Terraria the interface just doesn't stimulate creativity. But what about the pirating, you ask? Nah, it's basically get some levels in the earlygame and then you're set; just tank the enemy ship if cannons are present and then just board with everyone and just win with sheer numbers. Same for islands, just with no cannons.Overall very disappointed. Was it worth the $1.49 I paid for because this was on sale? Maybe, I did spend a little under 5 hours on it. 32 cents per hour of entertainment? Meh, at least I didn't lose much.TL;DR: Boring, bad interface, only go for it if it's on sale and you are really interested.

content:

												As soon as I saw the developer's name, I SHOULD have thought twice about buying this game but I loved the idea so much I bought it anyway when it first came out.Basically, the game has not changed since launch and by change I mean "it hasn't been completed." ... Just like all his other games. It's a great tech demo in a long line of tech demos that never get finished. There's plenty of balance issues, the UI breaks down as you try and keep up with the non-stop micromanagement. You can die for completely B.S. reasons (bugs) and lose everything. Worst of all, the game just stops being fun after the novelty wears off. He never added anything more to do. Your experience never grows. The first 30 minutes of gameplay is the same as the last 30 minutes of gameplay as you become so bored and frustated you just stop playing.This is the last time I give this guy money. I've learned my lesson.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2015
												This game, has very BIG performance issues.I think developers should understand that, and they should understand it very clearly that even a small mistake on the code / programming architecture returns SO MANY users as a loss of time.Skyrim loads on 10 secs, this game needs 1:45 secs to get to the next square on level 3 sized boat and lowest resolution on lowest opengl graphics!As you can see i forced my chances to finish the game, even played it on worse than amiga graphics lowest resolution (with unreadable texts, duh) but it was atill a nightmare; I dont know maybe because save file started to get fat.I really like simple graphics games, and this game has really nice visuality. Those forests, animals, exaggerated painful death voices... So far so good. But black screens and texts really gives the feeling that development phase interrupted early. But they made some changes to the game and released as single player...When you have big lists of something, anything; this game starts to fk up. And by big lists i mean 20+ or so, sadly. This list can be items put on boat / items on inventory / number of pirates / treasures shown on map or even visited places on map or shop list changes from the initial game. You can easily test this by trying to sell your weapons, having more than 1 page of weapons. It tries to draw everything again or something. Or did they define everthing as 3D? These mistakes are easy to spot, as being very beginner level.You can be sure that Unity offers many solutions when it comes to performance. While these are happening on devs' territory, what was the Valve's side of the story again? They could put more clear performance restrictions, no?I think devs should hire an expert, pay him whatever he wants, then apologize from the players and release an update. This is the best thing to do for the both parties. They could really make some money with this game, it has cute sides. Or they could just leave the fixing and make it free.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 9, 2016
												It's incredibly difficult to understand what's going on and why. For example, the way you'll find out about the Scurvy mechanic is when your entire first expedition dies to it. There's an Interact button, God alone knows why it's not the left mouse button, but you'll be standing in front of a chest like a moron and using Google to figure it out. There are Pets, but aside from Chickens (who lay eggs) and Crabs and Parrots (who attack) there doesn't appear to be a reason to keep the poop machines aboard. Speaking of poop, fully a third of your crew will be devoted to cleaning it off your ship. And if you'd like people to fish while you're at sea or your captain to dig while on shore, or anyone to capture animals, you'd better be prepared to enter the very klunky interface to change their weapons, as there's no way to carry fishing poles, animal traps, or shovels without them being one of your two primary weapons.There's a good game here, somewhere, but it's only a small step closer to usability than Dwarf Fortress and not nearly as entertaining.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								My addiction is high with this one. I got it and I instantly played it for like 3 hours. Learnt the controls and what not. Its SO much fun :D! Ok. Your a pirate. Out to get 'booty', a crew, food and booty. Along the way there are problems like unhappy crew, enemies on land and water, and money shortages. This game gets a 9/10 from me. I dont know what it is but its one of those games you play for a little bit, decide to take a break in 10 minutes, but 2 hours later you havent taken your eyes off it. It has a slight repeating factor to it, but it helps it. Most of the money and food I get is from enemy ships after I plunder them. I always like starting off with a first mate, just because you arent alone in the beginning. Then I really come to like the first crew guy ( mainly because they have a low pay-requirement ) and I tend to teach them EVERYTHING. If you can manage to get to guns and cannons and having a big crew with an even bigger ship, you can make it pretty far. In all honesty, im taking my time. I have played for 10 hours but im only at pirates with lvl 4 difficulty. You learn from mistakes, and the saving system is nice. I have little complaints. I really want to catch parrots and animals and slaves, but apparently thats not a feature yet even though the provide the requirements. Thats a little pet peeve of mine I guess. Your given things you cant get to without patience. But I know those are going to be provided in later updates ( Note : It updates often ). This is definetly a must try and I would gladly recommend it.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												Starting off, I do really like this game. I'd give it a 6/10. I played enough of it to gauge how it plays, and overall it is quite an enjoyable experience. It is one of those games that you could play for hours and not even notice how the time flies. "So why not a better score?" you may ask. For a few reasons. 1. The GUI     The menu is one of those that feels like it should be super smooth but isn't. While most of the time it is intuitive, some parts of it are very hard to inderstand, like how there is no "back" button after selecting a crewmember (or maybe I'm blind). It can also feel a bit clunky when it takes a second or two to load the Map.2. The Graphics     Yes, they're there. Yes, they're pixely. Yes, there is only one backround for big islands and one for the sea. Players want something interesting to look at while they decapitate turtles named Charlie, and a repeating forest tile isn't interesting.3. The Gameplay     The other stuff has been superficial, so lemme divide this a bit more:          a. Controlling Pirates               It's really wonky. There is barely any tutorialization with it (along with almost every other part of the game) and even then it sometimes doesn't do what one would want it to. If there was an actual tutorial in the game, it would fix a lot of its glaring problems.          b. Areas               There is next to no variation. There are Pirate encounters, Island encounters, and Towns. Islands are boring and give very little gold, Pirates are either super easy or super hard---there is no middle ground, and Towns sometimes don't give you what you want (I'm still looking for the end of my Bowstrip). With more, different areas, this game would be a thousand times better.          c. Sailing               Now I know this is gonna ruffle your feathers, but I actually like the "loading" aspect of the game. It adds charm. What I do not like, however, is what takes place while sailing. Nothing. Aside from a sea shanty or the sharpening of a blade on my grindstone, nothing happens. Again, no variety. All I see is the health tick up and hunger and moral tick down. If something were to happen of if my pirates would ACTUALLY CLEAN THAT♥♥♥♥♥♥OFF THE♥♥♥♥♥♥DECK then it would be a thouroughly enjoyable experience.So why a 6/10? The game sounds terrible! Nay, my friend, I love it. It is incredible addicting, almost a pokemon-esque type of feel. It's like I need to play, or I will die. And don't let that "time played= 4 hours" fool you. I played much more than that offline. Oh, and my ship is more beautiful than yours.If you like rouguelikes, non-story-driven RPG's, or evenarcade games, then Pixel piracy is for you. Plus, the dev is a cool dude. TL:DR: 6/10 but could be a 10/10P.S. Alex, I know you read every review, so I'd like to say a few things. Keep up the good work, and i left a message in that chat room that you said to PM you in. Cheers mate! ¡Dinero!

content:
Posted: March 13, 2014
Early Access Review
								"Heya there matey, ye shivers me timbers!" that is pretty much it.Now for real, this game is not for children, it is unforgiving, it is tactical, you have to take care of quite a lot aspects of your crew and ship management, and THE MOST important thing - your deck will often get pooped on.The biggest suprise for me was that this is not at all like Terraria or Starbound, you do not control your own character in a smash and hit way, it is much more like the old awesome "point and click rpgs" (like Baldurs Gate, Icewind Dale etc.). You control your captain and your crew by commands using just your mouse. But strangely enough how it is, it is not a flaw at all.I did not think that Pixel Piracy was so great. But to tell the truth this game is really one of the best I have played in a long time. It really can suck you in so easily, that you wont even know when to stop. Since you chop your first enemy in a half, youll be in pirate game heaven.10/10 and still improving !

Hire a huge crew,  In games like this with crew you can get i.e FTL (great game also recommend) you have a small crewin Pixel Piracy you can have a massive crew of over 20 people,  You can level them up teach them ect ect3.  A huge map with many encounters,  The encounters in the game can be islands towns ships and legendary ships (from what I have found)4.  Cheats!  If you want a more easy going sandbox mod you can use cheats to give you XP, Food, Moral, health, crew, money,  And rain thousands of cannon balls on your enemies.The bad:1 Glitches!  20 minutes in I ran into a glitch that stopped me from doing anything on that run.2 The controls,  Not the best in a game there not the worst but are hard and confusing to learn how to control everything3 The "Tutorial"  When you start you just get thrown in...  You can click "Help" and get some help but the explanation is not well done and leave you confused.4 Spelling!  I'm not the best speller ever i.e ^ but there is quite a few mistakes made in the game (Developers may not speak English native) but as'long as you don't have an o.c.d for spelling you will be fine.The ugly:MeRecommendation:  If the game is on sale go ahead it's very fun and ill be playing more 10 may be a bit for it but its still a good game worth the money.

content:
Posted: January 12, 2014
Early Access Review
								Pixel Piracy is a pretty fun little game that is sure to entertain you for a few hours at least. While it could use some more polish and some of the interfacing could be a little better, it is not a complete game. You can build a pirate ship, starting from a few free blocks, and basically it's a pirate sim from there. Start from boarding other small crafts to shooting cannons from your gigantic ship. There is a few things to keep track of though and time management is also a factor. It's really a hard game and you will surely lose a lot when you first start but you learn what to do different every time. After it's updated, I'm sure I will be able to say that Pixel Piracy is one of my favorite indie games out there.

content:
Posted: August 22, 2015
												+ Organize your own crew of pirates, hire new ones, pay them, give them new weapons and new skills.+ Modify your ship to your liking, add cannons, food, lights, and obviusly your own personalized sail!+ Get bounties by attacking other ships (AND BLOW THEM UP), conquer islands, find buried treasures, or claim bounties from wanted criminals.+ Tactical combat system based on target focus, items and planned strategy.+ Cute and funny voices for every characters, music fitting perfectly.+ Catch animals and make them your pets.+ Very challenging game if played at hard difficulty.+ Explore freely a self-generated sea.Do you need any more reason to buy this game?Oh yeah: it was made from the same people who created Terraria!

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2015
												The premise was promising: Terraria meets Sid Meier's Pirates, what could possibly go wrong?Well, a lot apparently.Right off the bat, the first problem I have is that I have no flipping clue what I'm doing. Nevermind all the arrs, the "tutorial" is hardly useful besides keeping you from dying before you even set sail. The interface is never explained in any notable detail, and the interface itself is unintuitive and badly designed. I still don't know how I'm supposed to save the game, even though the Exit Game button reminds me to, besides clicking that Exit Game button to force an autosave.The gameplay is also really really lacking. The premise of Terraria? No, not really. It's far better to capture better ships than to build your own, and unlike Terraria the interface just doesn't stimulate creativity. But what about the pirating, you ask? Nah, it's basically get some levels in the earlygame and then you're set; just tank the enemy ship if cannons are present and then just board with everyone and just win with sheer numbers. Same for islands, just with no cannons.Overall very disappointed. Was it worth the $1.49 I paid for because this was on sale? Maybe, I did spend a little under 5 hours on it. 32 cents per hour of entertainment? Meh, at least I didn't lose much.TL;DR: Boring, bad interface, only go for it if it's on sale and you are really interested.

content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
												As soon as I saw the developer's name, I SHOULD have thought twice about buying this game but I loved the idea so much I bought it anyway when it first came out.Basically, the game has not changed since launch and by change I mean "it hasn't been completed." ... Just like all his other games. It's a great tech demo in a long line of tech demos that never get finished. There's plenty of balance issues, the UI breaks down as you try and keep up with the non-stop micromanagement. You can die for completely B.S. reasons (bugs) and lose everything. Worst of all, the game just stops being fun after the novelty wears off. He never added anything more to do. Your experience never grows. The first 30 minutes of gameplay is the same as the last 30 minutes of gameplay as you become so bored and frustated you just stop playing.This is the last time I give this guy money. I've learned my lesson.

								So far it's a cute, tough as nails rogue-lite pirate simulator with minecraft-esque ship building. The pirate combat can be a bit clunky for advanced tactices like focusing down targets but encounters are a lot of fun and learning when to back off can be a hillarious lesson in humility. content:
Posted: April 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								Okay I dont usually write reviews for games... Okay I never do. But for this game it brought a different aspect in gaming that I never seen before, or i dont think... I love the type of gameplay that this has. It brings a level of certain strategy cause you have to wonder "Can this island/ship be raidable?" "Will any of my crew die in this attack?" The type of gameplay is like my favorite game on the DS "Fire Emblem" but for this game it isnt turn based. Its all out sending in your troops. I also like how you can save your game at the end of each map so that if your crew does end up dieng in the next round by hunger, drowning, or pirates, you can go back to ur last save and start it over or choose a different path.Overall I rate this game about 8/10 This game really passes time (even though i only played a little bit) and i really feel like it was worth the money. :)

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								I first dismissed Pixel Piracy because I am not fond of 2d side-scrolling games and even though I put in plenty of effort I failed to enjoy Terraria which was advertised as similar in form and function.  Despite those discouragements I purchased Pixel Piracy  because I had a coupon that reduced the price a bit and had finally become bored with Rogue Legacy (awesome game).  Pixel Piracy has exceeded my expectations, its graphics and animations are charming in a minimalistic way and its sand-box rogue-like world creation increases its replay abilty.  There are still some bugs to work out, but the gameplay is easy to understand and I promise that if you give this game a half a chance it should at least be 20 hours of fun for you... also its resource requirements are minimal so you can play it on your back-up laptop :)

content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
Product received for free
												I got this game through a CD Key from a website.I saw it was made from the same people who made Terraria so I got all excited, but it really was a disappointment for me.The tutorial truely confused me and left me scratching my head for 20 minutes.Then I skipped the tutorial and tried to play, but.. it just is overcomplicated.They could have made it so that instead of clicking where to go you can move the captain yourself using wasd and space bar. And groups or teams could be selected to go or just all go in one click. There really is no need for a tutorial if they just cleared up what to do and what things do rather than explaining or saying you have to buy.I thought this would be a pirate game somewhat like terraria, but I was wrong.Some people may disagree, but I rate this game 6/10.6/10 instead of anything lower because this game is fun to others, but its not as fun to me.In conclusion if you like RTS's, building, and 2d action, then you'll probably like this game, but since I only got about 27 mins into the game please read other reviews before concluding on this.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								I was expecting the same controls for Terraria/Arthur's Gold, but i was wrong.The controls are weird at first, Arrow keys/A D controls your camera, left click controls your captain, right click controls your crew; well you are not exactly controlling anything, it's sort of... a command where the AI tries to follow it.The start can be tough for some people, initial stats are random you can end up with "useless" stats and you early game can be even "harder".There is a Morale and Hunger bar, most of the people tries to fill morale by paying salaries but you can do it for free at the tavern only pay salaries when you are really far from any town with a tavern or you crew wont listen to you and eventually they will attack you; Hunger is not a problem at all, your ship starts with 2 watermelons (2 servings each), once you learn cooking and fishing (and get a fishing rod) you will be fine, you can even sell extra fish to get more gold.It is a good game lots of fun so far, and i definitely recommend it, expect bugs/balance issues, but as a beta game that's to be expected, looking forward to 1.0 :)

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 10, 2014
Early Access Review
								 I began by naming  myself Euguene Krabs, captured a crew of animals, a dog , a turtle and a crab. I forgot to buy food and almost starved.  A little later my crab died during a raid. I was demoralized. Then the turtle shortly after drowned after being knocked off the ship. I promised myself the same wouldn't happen with the dog. So I hired a REAL crew, the Krusty Krew. I had a cook , a poo cleaner a cannonneer , and 2 fighter specialists. Oh! Did we raid, we sunk many ships, killed dozens of natives, pooped everywhere, and drank rum all the time. But....unfortunately this game was early access.  After raiding a ship, you destroy it up to get its contents. The dog Douglass was on the  enemy ship and for some reason the command to carry him to ours wasn't working. So with tears in my eyes  I blew up the enemy ship and watched Douglass perish too. To this day me and my 8 man crew still pillag, still drink , and still laugh but we don't forget the original crew who set sail with me long before.....8/10 very fun, but will remind you occasionally that its early access.

content:
Posted: August 9, 2014
												UPDATE 08/17/2014:Repetetive, fun and flavorful. $15 feels a bit much, but this is worth a sale price.Crew and ship management aside, there are only 3 actions that make up the gameplay.Visit friendly town.Visit hostile island.Visit hostile ship.All hostile encounters are very brief, which is super smart. Otherwise the repetition would be tedious. Quick encounters with quick rewards and rapidly advancing crew capabilities do an admirable job of compensating for the lack of variety in actual gameplay. One hidden gem is the soundtrack. There are some quality songs in here. Highly recommended viewing:

content:
Posted: April 2, 2015
												First of all, Pixel Piracy is a really fun game that I feel like I've been waiting my entire life for. Ever since going on a one piece kick several years ago, I've wanted to sail the sees collecting crew and deal with the problems that pirates have to, and Pixel Piracy delivers on most accounts.Unfortunately, while the random events are exciting in the beginning, after a while they start to feel samey. Gathering a crew is fun and it hurts when they die as death is permanent, but once you get a large crew you start to realize that aside from whatever random thing the person says, everyone is basically the same.The pirate ship customization was a nice feature, but I found stealing and adding to other ships to be a much preferable alternative to making one from scratch.I got a good ten hours out of the game before I stopped playing, raising multiple pirate crews in the mean time. The last crew I played I decided that I would reset every time one of my crew members died so I'd finally get to challenge a legendary pirate. I got bored before then, and I doubt I'll ever get around to playing that far again.All in all, I had a lot of fun when I was playing it, and I was glad that I never had to look up a wiki thanks to an in game help section, which really wiled away the time spent sailing. I definitely recommend it to anyone who likes pirates, just don't expect too much out of it.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								I came into this expecting very little actually and what I got was a whole lot more than that. I was practically blind going into this, I hadn't even seen gameplay footage, just a screenshot showing off a large, complex ship, fighting another large complex ship with a whole lot of bloom lighting effects.Turns out there's a lot more to this game than just the bloom graphics. The game is essentially an extremely accessible risk vs. reward strategy game, where progress is rewarded with more money to purchase shipbuilding materials, skills, hire more crewmembers, tools, weapons, etc. Because it's easy to get jump aboard and get right to playing and making progress, the game is extremely accessible to new players of the strategy genre.What hooked me is ship building. The game has this focus on gaining more and more material to build your ship with by destroying other ships to loot their materials, allowing you to add on to your own ship using them. Additionally, you can purchase new materials and decorations for your ship with gold you earn from taking on enemy ships and plundering their precious loot.While I got the game for free due (Thanks Gameiki.com and HERO) I would definitely say it’s worth the money they’re asking for, and since Relogic aquired publishing rights for the game, there is probably, like 1000s of steam coupons floating around for the game if you don’t have it and want a discount. (Provided it’s not already on sale, which at the time of this review, It is)

content:
Posted: June 19, 2015
												Pixel Piracy is a great indie rpg with rougelike elements.  You create a captain and sail around your world fighting pirates, visiting islands, discovering treasure, and learning secrets. All while leveling up your captain and crew and building a bigger and better ship!  All this in pixelie 2D pirate action! I recommend this to anyone who is a fan of indie games, 2D RPG's or "rougelike likes".

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 27, 2016
Product received for free
												I got this game through a CD Key from a website.I saw it was made from the same people who made Terraria so I got all excited, but it really was a disappointment for me.The tutorial truely confused me and left me scratching my head for 20 minutes.Then I skipped the tutorial and tried to play, but.. it just is overcomplicated.They could have made it so that instead of clicking where to go you can move the captain yourself using wasd and space bar. And groups or teams could be selected to go or just all go in one click. There really is no need for a tutorial if they just cleared up what to do and what things do rather than explaining or saying you have to buy.I thought this would be a pirate game somewhat like terraria, but I was wrong.Some people may disagree, but I rate this game 6/10.6/10 instead of anything lower because this game is fun to others, but its not as fun to me.In conclusion if you like RTS's, building, and 2d action, then you'll probably like this game, but since I only got about 27 mins into the game please read other reviews before concluding on this.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								I was expecting the same controls for Terraria/Arthur's Gold, but i was wrong.The controls are weird at first, Arrow keys/A D controls your camera, left click controls your captain, right click controls your crew; well you are not exactly controlling anything, it's sort of... a command where the AI tries to follow it.The start can be tough for some people, initial stats are random you can end up with "useless" stats and you early game can be even "harder".There is a Morale and Hunger bar, most of the people tries to fill morale by paying salaries but you can do it for free at the tavern only pay salaries when you are really far from any town with a tavern or you crew wont listen to you and eventually they will attack you; Hunger is not a problem at all, your ship starts with 2 watermelons (2 servings each), once you learn cooking and fishing (and get a fishing rod) you will be fine, you can even sell extra fish to get more gold.It is a good game lots of fun so far, and i definitely recommend it, expect bugs/balance issues, but as a beta game that's to be expected, looking forward to 1.0 :)

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 10, 2014
Early Access Review
								 I began by naming  myself Euguene Krabs, captured a crew of animals, a dog , a turtle and a crab. I forgot to buy food and almost starved.  A little later my crab died during a raid. I was demoralized. Then the turtle shortly after drowned after being knocked off the ship. I promised myself the same wouldn't happen with the dog. So I hired a REAL crew, the Krusty Krew. I had a cook , a poo cleaner a cannonneer , and 2 fighter specialists. Oh! Did we raid, we sunk many ships, killed dozens of natives, pooped everywhere, and drank rum all the time. But....unfortunately this game was early access.  After raiding a ship, you destroy it up to get its contents. The dog Douglass was on the  enemy ship and for some reason the command to carry him to ours wasn't working. So with tears in my eyes  I blew up the enemy ship and watched Douglass perish too. To this day me and my 8 man crew still pillag, still drink , and still laugh but we don't forget the original crew who set sail with me long before.....8/10 very fun, but will remind you occasionally that its early access.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 9, 2014
												UPDATE 08/17/2014:Repetetive, fun and flavorful. $15 feels a bit much, but this is worth a sale price.Crew and ship management aside, there are only 3 actions that make up the gameplay.Visit friendly town.Visit hostile island.Visit hostile ship.All hostile encounters are very brief, which is super smart. Otherwise the repetition would be tedious. Quick encounters with quick rewards and rapidly advancing crew capabilities do an admirable job of compensating for the lack of variety in actual gameplay. One hidden gem is the soundtrack. There are some quality songs in here. Highly recommended viewing:


YouTube™ Video: [Official Trailer] Pixel Piracy - 9 Drinks 

			Views: 10,069		

			AHOY MATEY, STILL WANNA JOIN MY CREW & SAIL AROUND THE WORLD ? THIS IS NOW OR NEVER. Game : Pixel Piracy http://store.steampowered.com/app/264140/ Gimme these pirates some money, matey.		

Other than that, what you see is what you get.

Early Access Review
								Other than when people graple onto my ship and fly into space, and everytime you kill a crate or animal you get a level up, this game is great. After a while if you have only been using one pirate, he can dodge every shot, insta-kill everything, and move extremely fast, so if you want to have a challenge in the game, make a larger crew. I myself have beaten all of the legendary enemies, but have not beaten all of the groups that appear after each legendary enemy is destroyed. In my opinion, the game can end too fast, but getting to the end is really fun :3

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1
												Pirates? - check.Adventures? - check.Fancy graphics? - check.Strange noices? - check.Multiplayer? - hmm... sorry, not yet won't even have, most likely.Pixel Piracy is entertaining pixel styled game about pirates! You start with 2 men crew (including yourself), raid and pillage enemy ships, get money, buy weapons, new ships and new crew members! Then you raid and pillage more enemy ships, get more money, buy more weapons, better ships, recruit more crew members and so on! Hmm... I made it sound very boring, did not I I?... But there's not much to it, to be honest. It's not a good game for endless gameplay. It's great for people who want to play game for few minutes on free times. "there are better games if I want to spend my time if I have small free time. And they are more cheap." - you will say. You are wrong. What's better than raiding and burning enemy ships, getting money to recruit crew members, buying them cool weapons and getting them big ship?! There's nothing more interesting, of course! Plus, every pirate has different sound effect! erm... what?! They make different fancy sounds, I mean... saying some strange things which I can't remember... So, um... It's cool game, I want to say!If you ask if this game's worth buying or not, I'll tell you this: Get this game on sale. I personally got it from bundle some time ago, so I'm satisfied with it. To be honest, I don't think devs are going to make more developments to this game, so don't expect lot from it. Game's not too big, so it will get boring after a while - that's why I said it's for people who want to play a game when they have small free time on their hands. I personally have not played a lot yet, but I can say one thing for sure - I like it very much!Edit: Forgot to say, there's actually more to this game! There are poops! what?! Yes, you heard it correctly! Birds poop on your ship, so one of the crew members go and drop it into the water! Interesting, isn't it?! or I'm just strange to be interested in throwing poops into the water Only people similar to me can understand! There's also an achievement to have 5 poops on your ship at once!

Posted: March 22, 2016
												I purchased this with a coupon from badges, and I'm glad I was able to get it for so cheap. It has a lot of potential, but as is it's just not worth it. The tutorial isn't very helpful beyond the very basics, and the UI/controls are clunky and difficult to figure out. This could be annoying, but combined with the fact that after a while, the game either slows down to unplayable speeds or your crew inexplicably stops responding to commands no matter what yo try, make this not worthwhile. I like the graphics, and I liked the concept, but the execution is pretty bad.

content:
Posted: May 18, 2015
												Pixel PiracyControls: 68/100 Mouse+KeyboardScreen Movement: A  or ←  D or → Right click: Control your crew to move or attackafter selecting group 1-6Left click: Control your captain to moveor attack and to select options.Spacebar: Interacts with objects like Totems,Stores, as well as Treasure ChestsESC: Pauses game and activates the menu screenIt is also used when your captain dies.Keys 1-6: Groups you can assign crew-mates toSelect a group to use right click.Icon Interaction left click and drag: Drag commands from the bottom icons to move your units/crew.Interact: Icon (F)  Move your captain to the object, then click theinteract icon, or F key, to interact withPlunder Icon: Begin a plunder of the enemy ship which gives.Capture Icon: Take control and capture enemy ship (Losing your actual one)The controls Are is a bit to much for beginners plus the game has no Controller support sadly I was hoping for but its fine.. Keyboard is ok I guess.Audio: 92/100The music And Sound is Perfect for the game But when it comes to commanding a lot the sounds get a bit annoying but I can't complain to much about it I'll just say its well themed for the game. I would say it needs more sound affects to weapons like small beat music to them when you attack the enemies.Graphics: 64/100The Graphics are ok but when it comes to computers it will lag for some reason it needs more improvements on it so it won't lag or something. But again I love the graphics its perfect. Your doing a great job lazy developer.Balance Between Challenging and Impossible: 75/100 (Don't count as points)Its Easy to get going in the game but a bit hard to keep up with your crew and payment which increase like crazy over a damn minute of playing the game it needs to be a bit slow like real life job pay off so it won't be such a problem I mean it depends on the Difficulty you picked. The enemies are a easy kill so  I want more Random Events like being Attacked by Sea Creatures something well related to Jack Sparrow, Monster attacking towns. Fighting angels and devil. Mountains that you enter to go into caves or underground hunting for certain items.. Thousands of quest to do. Shark attacks, Snowy islands , Lava. Everything you can put into this game. Its Easy to play so make it more interesting and challenging..Other: 40/100I would like to see a calender, a better night/Day time System when time changes the whole island changes to spring, summer, winter etc Main Stories and a bunch sub side stories that would interest the gamer to be stuck into the game. I recommend this game to those who love adventure.Rated 264/400

content:
Posted: February 11, 2016
This review takes an in-depth look at all of the ways that Quadro Delta's Pixel Piracy fails in design and execution (even after its updates).[. . .] Pixel Piracy tries to be a lot of things: an RTS game, a ship-building exploration game, a party-based RPG, and a roguelike. The result is a very weak example of each and every one of those genres—if I didn’t consider it overly charitable to call it a ‘jack’ of anything, the saying ‘jack of all trades, master of none’ would apply. content:
Posted: April 13, 2014
												Pixel piracy!With drunken sailors and bearded women you set sail to be the best and possible the worst pirate ever made! by a few choices your have made ur uggly fearless pirate and embark on your quest,First things first read the handbok:1. dont attack a pirate larger then level 1 or it will ear you alive and drink rum from ur skull.2. dont sail to an island as level 1 or this will also kill you.3. dont forget to pay the scum you have aboard yea thats right unless you want to end up in the water..4. Learn the crew how to poo,Eat,Clean and yea maybe kill something if ur lucky.5. Build a floating bucket, must look like a barrel extra points if its a flying ship.6. Stay alive and remember that crew eat, well.... depends sometimes they dont cause they whanna die of hunger dont worry this is totally normal since you dont eat... much7. Tame animals and die trying, laugh repeat and then die some more.8. Dig everywhere, you never know...9. Rum boost morale and makes you drunken master in fighting "yeaaap"10. Never bring a chicken to a rum fight.All in all a must have and i really hope they continue with this game idea its great and when they finish this one the should make another or juts improve this one!! yea thats right make it more epic then epic.. yea polish a gem to be a bigger one! erm.. YEA! 10/10 (the game has taken ages to be this good and if you deside to make a sequel they better not in the seven hells release to soon, but honestly make this game better and better and who knows u might be able to even start with dlc's)Go for it.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								After spending a few hours with this game, I would like to pen my fustration and annoyance, as the autosave feature doesnt actually create a save file.It's a pretty solid base for a game, make a ship, collect gold, level up skills, earn a crew, fight bigger enemies. I enjoyed playing it after the initial 20minutes it took me to realise WTF I was doing, and learnt which fights to avoid (hover over enemies to check their health).A tutorial would be fantastic, as it's a little bit tough to get your head around what is going on. I still dont know how to catch animals, but theres a whole menu for it when you press esc. Speaking of, the escape menu is terrible. You cant check your inventory without going to the individual pirates page and equiping them, you need to press a little hidden button in the top left to set sail when you've navigated to an area and there's not really any indication of what you can do/when. The AI for crew and captain is terrible, you have to click like a madman to get out of a fight you are losing. There's minimal ways to heal an injured teammate. There's no direction to the game either, no overarching story line that'd "hook" me to play again.Saying that, when I was playing I was having fun blowing up ships and trying to cheat the RNG encounters at sea. It's cute seeing captain feathersword get his♥♥♥♥♥handed to him time and time again.All in all, needs more work done to it to turn this concept game into a functioning, polished, user-friendly state.4/10.TL;DR - Pirates! The difficulty curve is too high for too little reward. Pick this game up in a few years.

number of helpful: 6 of 12 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 23, 2016
												Although many enjoy this game, I did not. I've only played 20 minutes of it and I'm completly confused and lost. The game did a terrible job of describing what I should do. Although I do wish for a lot of freedom in games, after the tutorial of this game I found myself not knowning what I was doing, what I was going to do, and how I would even do it. I walked blindly through the game trying to work out mechanics as I went but it was very difficult to do so. I wish for the best for this game and the creators but I wish that some more explantion can be thrown into the tutorial. I should not have to watch a video on the internet to figure out how to play. I will give this game another try once I watch some videos made by experts, but until then I will question if my 10$ spent on this game was really worth it. I'm not able to put much money into video games, so I hope that some discovery can turn my current opinion around. Thank you,  ---Boomer

content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												Nope.Saw some popular youtubers playing this a while back. I bought it, because it seemed like a great game, and the fact that it was early access just meant that it would be added to above this to me, so I downloaded it.Upon launch, crash. Well, okay then, I suppose it's early access.Launch again, play for a bit. To be honest I would have prefered it crash again. You don't have any freedom to create a ship, it's like being told to build big ben and being given half a bucket of lego bricks.As far as actually playing goes, it was about as balanced as the ocean we were sailing on. I would either painfully slowly watch as I got a tiny bit of income after paying my crew and buying essential supplies, because the gameplay just does not pay up. The fighting is pretty much just throw all your crew at the other ship, if you have more crew, you might well win. If not, then you're going to come out of that fight dead or with less crew, and at that point, it's going to take a while to get another crew member.And that's just the ship fights, you so much as set foot on an island and the locals will maul you to death. And then I see that there are 'epics' floating around in the open waters. Packed full of crew. And cannons. Yeah! there are cannons. Good luck ever finding out how the hell you can get them on your ship, never played long enough.Oh and then it crashed. I said I might come back and have a look later when it's further through development.What's that? The developers abandoned it and left a single man on the case?......This game put me off early access. Don't buy it.

number of helpful: 11 of 23 people (48%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 8, 2015
												Forget pixel piracy. Garbage like this is why real piracy exists. Charging even 1 cent for this game is where the real piracy is. This game is so awful that the original devs abandoned it and some other guy bought it out. It is really awful even if I keep playing and try to figure out what to do. No wonder at one point this game had mostly negative reviews. I guess it has been worked on over the year it has been out and improved. It still sucks so badly that I would hate to see what it was like when it first came out. It does not deserve the mostly positive reviews that it has now because it just sucks. A prime example of how not to make a indie game. Lack of direction, non-intuitive controls, and stupid logic. The interface is mainly what is so unintuitive about the game. It is riddled with glitches, bugs, and technical problems out the wazzu according to other users. The game has a complete lack of technical polish. One of the most technically unsound games I have ever played. A very messy game all around. It just never felt tight and smooth for me like any other good game would, just felt like a rough garbled mess of a pre-alpha because it basically is. You and your crew are mentally incapable (much like this games creators) of taking a dump over the side of the ship so your ship just fills up with feces. The first island I "sailed" to had a few little creatures on it. I got off with my captain and tried going to them to use the "move animal" command. They started attacking me which is fine they are wild animals, but I couldn't kill them even though they are what looks to be chickens and ferrets. They chase me back to the ship. I command my crew of two to go and kill them, they immediately knockback my crew off the island into the water where not only can they not swim, they sink to the bottom of the ocean, game over.They also treat the gamer like an idiot as well and make fun of you just to be smart a--es on purpose. The first time a pirate killed me I got a achievement called "Noob". Purposely called a noob by the developers because I died because of their total lack of direction lol. They celebrate the fact that the game has knockback by asking you what percentage of knockback you want when you start a new game, like they are saying "ha ha, our game has knock back like it or not". The game should not have knockback. Why should it? Do I fly 5ft backwards irl when a ferret touches me? Why does this game need to have knockback? Why does any game for that matter? Do I jump in water and immediately sink and drown irl? Does anybody? No, but they don't care what you as a gamer think and that is strikingly apparant in every area of this game's horrible, flawed, outdated and broken design.I have never seen a game this badly void of any basic logic and with such a heavy lack of direction and unintuitive controls. There was no music and the only sound effects are a ten year old kid saying "son of a biscuit!" over and over and over and over nonstop and some other pirate phrases being said in either high pitch voices to sound like chipmonks or low pitched which still sounds like a ten year old kids voice being pitch shifted low.I got this in a bundle I bought for Unepic, which is a good game. They might as well have bundled a bloody vag rag with aids on it with Unepic instead of this game. This game is going into the trash bin. You want a real sailing game where you get to be a pirate? Play Assassin's Creed 4. Out of the 570+ games I own on steam, this is in the top ten for worst.If you were allowed to trade your games and I could trade this for a punch in the nose I would consider that totally fair because that is about what this dog♥♥♥♥♥♥suck garbage is worth. -100/10. Go f--k yourselves.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
												The game is only worth it's current sale price which is 85% off 9.99 aka $1.49 USD.They released the game unfinished, and continued to fix their mistakes (yay) for several months maybe even a year.Sadly, they never finished fixing all the bugs, or adding all the content, and now the devs as far as I know have abandoned the game.Q.) Is it playable?A.) It has a few hours worth of gameplay, before encouting bugs and late game balance issues. Actually, everything is unbalanced.You know, save yourself some money and only get the game on sale.I personally wouldn't recommend anything from these devs, unfortunately. This game was decent, then broken, then in development, then released, then in more development... Sadly the end result isn't much better than where it was. And a sloppy developer isn't going to get better the more money you throw at them.And the OST? Lol, not worth $3.99. Should be part of buying the game.Sorry, I just lost faith after all the tweaking and supposed fixes that eventually changed really nothing. it was fun while it lasted in development, because there were excuses for it all. But it hasn't been in early access for... Idk, over a year, maybe 2 years? I lost track of time. I'm only here to not recommend the game.It's your money, spend it how you want.R.I.P. Pixel Piracy.

content:
Posted: May 2, 2016
												Pixel Piracy can be resumed as a concept game with unhealthy obsessions for poop deck jokes and pixelated bleeding. The concept works simply and well enough to be fun for about 20 hours of game play, then it gets quite repetitive. You side scroll pirate ship battles, build a ship and a crew from your plunders and find booty yarr! That's about it.For it's peculiar game play and to encourage Indie game developers I have no problem recommending it, but don't expect to find much more than what's on the cover.

												Normally I do not write reviews, but after reading all of the over the top negative reviews I figured I would write one to more accurately depict the game.Are there a few bugs?  Sure there are, but the Devs update the game weekly to fix any known issues.The biggest complaint I can find is that there is a bit of a steep learning curve.  However, once the mechanics and controls of the game are understood the game is very enjoyable.  You get to custom build a ship; you can choose to either take over or plunder an enemy ship; you can even engage in ship vs ship events and island invasions.  The music is catchy and after hours of playing this game you'll find yourself talking like a pirate!  Ultimately, Pixel PIracy is game that will provide hours of entertainment and while at times the game feels a bit stale due to the repetiveness of gameplay who doesn't enjoy roaming the seas with a crew of pirates?!
