content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												Now that the 1.0 is officially released, the game is significantly more playable and provides fun with a sense of purpose. I hope to see continuing updates as there are some things that I dislike (mayhaps it is intentional?)   --Hunger is difficult to suppress and most foods only provide HP, not hunger (it should help at least a tiny bit?)    --Numerous times I had just fed my poor pirates as I scoured town to town to buy food to stock on the ship which they then had to be on the boat to eat.    --These pirates are savages! They don't share the food and only think about themselves. I wish there was someway to ration or manually make one eat.   --Hunger goes down way too fast, I finally got to a shop and spent all the money I had only to run back to the ship to eat it and be basically slightly better off than I was before, but now poor.   --Food doesn't cost a lot, but I often never have money to buy enough. Most games conclude in starvation.    --All the previous notes are about hunger; but there are times the screen gets really convoluted. Why can't I zoom in/out anymore? It was a decent function.   --ALSO, a huge thing that really bothers me is that when you stock food in a barrel and the barrel is removed (e.g., if you capture a different ship) the food disappears! I mean, you stock up all your money and go on a long trip and find a sick pirate ship that you can steal (cuz thats what pirates do) and you have no food in the middle of nowhere. And why are there seagulls pooping on my ship in the middle of the ocean!?   --So ya think that fishing would solve the hunger issue... "Oh just get yourself the fishing rod and fish/cook skill!" Well not so fast my scurvied friend, the pirates have such bad ADHD that they can't do just ONE task. Fishing is never effective because he would rather clean up poop or glutton over the ramen in the 5th barrel i had to buy or practice with the sword rack when he really doesn't need to. It is a great game. I just have a headache from the little pirates not doing what I want them to.

content:
Posted: August 6, 2014
												This game is not too complex, but it is enjoyable. I recommend any game that gets me for 8+ hours (I don't have much time to play).It has something magic on doing 4 things for hours. You go to shop, you modify your ship, you go to islands and you fight other ships. That's it, but you can't quit. Maybe it is because you need to know if you are going to have money for your sailor's salaries. Maybe it is because you want to take out all other pirates and be the king of pirates. Maybe you just want to trap chickens and train them to be a killing machine. Or maybe you just want to have your ship as a Royal Caribbean cruise with all the ammenities and plenty of food.I would recommend if pixel graphics don't bother you, and you enjoy non-intensive action games.Graphics: 7 if you like pixel graphics. Colorful, nice, few images (repeated)Gameplay: 8: simple click and wasd, grinding, waiting times where you just check your crew to avoid a mutiny. But it has something that prevents you from quitting the game (maybe it's because it has an autosave feature and I don't have an idea how to manually save)Story: 9: well, not a really rich story (no story at all), but who the heck wouldn't like to be a pirate.Fun: 9. This game is very enjoyable.Note: I've read some comments where they complaint about bugs. I haven't got any bugs so far. My pirates won't suicide or drown into the water (maybe they have to change their ship layout). No crashes so far.

												I have about 20 hours logged into this game so far and I've really enjoyed what I've seen.  It does have a few things outstanding that could use some polish,  but there is so much potential here that I am excited to keep playing and watch what the developers turn out each patch, who are still very much hard at work.When you start the game there will be a slight learning curve as you figure out how to manage your crew's morale (hint: restore it for free by sending them to taverns) and your ship's food supply (hint: train a fisherman with high luck) then you can really start exploring and having fun with the game.If you run into a bug, just search the community forums for a workaround; so far I haven't encountered any that were game breaking.

content:
Posted: August 1, 2014
												Overall Score: 9/10Pros:  I have been playing this game since early access. This game has gone through many development stages. Based upon player feedback they fixed many bugs and made many enhancements to the game. I can honestly say that I am proud to have been part of the experience. With that said if you ever wanted to be a captain of a ship and enjoy awesome pixel retro graphics then this is the game for you. This is a strategy game where you must keep your crew, fed, happy and try not to get them killed. Your crew will level up and you must decide to boost their stats or have them learn new skills. The game is very balanced, changing while still maintaining the fun factor. The game is out of early access but the developers are continuing to give the game free updates.Did I forget to mention that you can build and fully customize your pirate ship? The game delivers as not just a pirate sim but as an overall game. The offer tons of replay value and you can’t beat it for the price.Cons:  Being that I have to pick something it’s that there aren’t any type of multiplayer modes. However, the game doesn’t need it as the game is really designed be a single player game. However, if they were to add a PVP mode in the future where you could have ship battles that would add an entirely new game its self.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
												So I have to admit, I had been kicking around the idea of buying this game for quite some time.  I finally pulled the trigger during the Steam Holiday Sale.  I honestly can't remember how much I spent.  After a few hours of gameplay, seeing how passionate the Developer is about not only the product itself, but how much it means for he or she to get the title out there to people who are less fortunate, I cannot but help give a positive recommendation for this title. The recent surge in the 8/16 -bit graphics looking games has really given me the nostalgia of from when I was kid growing up in the 80's and early 90's.  Whats not to love?  Pirates, pillaging, and poop.  Sure, it feels a little repetative after a bit, but I have yet to encounter a game over the years that is not repetetive in some form or fashion.  Easy read tutorials make it easy to learn.   Building your crew may take a little time. I was up to a crew of five within a couple hours.  Let there be no mistake training your crew is core to your success as captain.  All in all, its tongue in cheek humor, cheeky sea shanties, and the ability to build and sail your vessel as you see fit makes me wish I had purchased it sooner.   I would have gladly paid full price knowing what I know now about the game and developer.  I on a scale of ten, I give it a solid 8+.The only real critique/suggestion I would make:  keep speacialty skills as purchasable items, but turn them into professions(boarding party, gunners, shipwrights , etc.).  Things like swimming, cleaning, and other basic seamanship skills should be default progression when your sailors level up.

The recent surge in the 8/16 -bit graphics looking games has really given me the nostalgia of from when I was kid growing up in the 80's and early 90's.  Whats not to love?  Pirates, pillaging, and poop.  Sure, it feels a little repetative after a bit, but I have yet to encounter a game over the years that is not repetetive in some form or fashion.  Easy read tutorials make it easy to learn.   Building your crew may take a little time. I was up to a crew of five within a couple hours.  Let there be no mistake training your crew is core to your success as captain.  All in all, its tongue in cheek humor, cheeky sea shanties, and the ability to build and sail your vessel as you see fit makes me wish I had purchased it sooner.   I would have gladly paid full price knowing what I know now about the game and developer.  I on a scale of ten, I give it a solid 8+.The only real critique/suggestion I would make:  keep speacialty skills as purchasable items, but turn them into professions(boarding party, gunners, shipwrights , etc.).  Things like swimming, cleaning, and other basic seamanship skills should be default progression when your sailors level up.

content:
Posted: April 24, 2015
'Do you recommend this game'? yes.Let me tell you the tale of the SS-SWAGAROONY. There once was a brave pirate called 'Austin Tkushaka', Austin Tkushaka was the son of some pirate idk lets get to the point. So Austin Tkushaka had one dream and one dream only, to have a decently looking ship and more than 2 crew members. Austin Tkushaka went to a nearby tavern to get together a crew, and by a crew of course I mean just one person. After about 10 seconds of searching Austin found the perfect person. Austin had the power to somehow name all of his crew members so he called it '*****', I have to bleep the name for security reasons but lets just call him Chang. So Austin and Chang set off like 14 metres and fought off an island, they then decided to up their game and start taking on level one boats.buuuuuuutt they wanted another crew member before they started getting extreme, and so Austin and Chang went back to the tavern and got this hippy-looking guy who used to make hats. Because of his hat making, we gave him the very formal nickname 'Fashion ♥♥♥'. So with this new kid on da block, they decided to start taking shipsbuuuuuuutt they wanted to do one more island first. They went to an island right next to the one they just conquered, and on it was a single dark skinned man. Austin, Chang and Fashion ♥♥♥ went off the boat and started beating him up, when he begged for his life and asked if he could join us, Austin said yes. Like I mentioned earlier, Austin had the power to change people’s names, so he called him 'Abbo man'. (By abbo of course Austin means A.B.B.A but it was like a spelling error I swear to god plz no hate).So Abbo man joined Austin, Chang and Fashion ♥♥♥ in their quest for decent ship. They then started their boat-taking quest.They were successful with their boat-taking, they captured like 2 boats and were successful in their endeavours, UNTILLL they decided to capture a very particular boat. Wait no the boat was normal and boring but it was really particular and special because this is the boat that killed Austin Tkushaka. Sorry give me a moment I’m getting emotional. So back to the story, Austin Tkushaka had just died and the crew took over the ship and killed everyone inside. Chang, being the first person Austin had hired, because the new leader of the SS-SWAGAROONY. Now Chang leading the SS-SWAGAROONY was the biggest change the group had experienced ever in the history of life. Chang decided that they wanted to ride in style instead of some scrubby boat, so they tried to take over a level 2 ship and succeeded. Another thing Chang did was add the 3 greatest, well some of the greatest, fighters in SS-SWAGAROONY history. These were 'party man', 'ahghghgggh', and 'rave man'. All of them had equal stats throughout the time they were aboard the SS-SWAGAROONY. So now the ship had 6 people on it and was being lead by Chang. With Chang’s help the group was just about ready to get a level 3 ship, when suddenly, Chang died. To be completely honest I forgot how Chang died, but I THINK that it was in a battle on a ship, lets just say that for story purposes. So the next person in line for the SS-SWAGAROONY was Fashion ♥♥♥. The first thing Fashion ♥♥♥ did when he got power was get a level 3 ship. Then he decided to fix the fact that there was poop all over the boat. They travelled and they travelled, looking for gold to buy for the 'cleaning' book. After some time, they got the book and Fashion ♥♥♥ learn how to throw poop off the side of the ship, proving his worth as a leader. Fashion ♥♥♥ then continued to change the SS-SWAGAROONY. He added 3 or 4 more people (who turned out to be so useless I don’t remember their names) to the ship and he trained everybody. Another thing he did was stock up on food. And by stock up i mean 90% of the ship floors would be some type of food. He also got this really cool level 4 ship.But Fashion ♥♥♥ had one flaw which would make him the worst leader in SS-SWAGAROONY history, he was like two times slower than everyone else in the game. So like when we went to take over a ship, when they were done he would finally get onto the ship. Now this was the biggest issue on the SS-SWAGAROONY at the moment, so Fashion ♥♥♥ decided to fix it before it was too late. Fashion ♥♥♥ looked far and wide for a solution too his slowness, and in a level 3 town he found it, a book which change his walking speed by 10%. Buuuut he had already spent all his money on food so Fashion ♥♥♥ needed a solutionTL;DR: he started destroying boats and then sold all his weapons and had around 5 thousand dollars. he then got the book but it make like no differenceThis is where things started going bad, right at this moment. See Fashion ♥♥♥ needed to spend all this money somehow, so he looked for a level 4 towns and never found one, but instead started seeing vikings and level 5 ships. He did not encounter many, and so far Fashion ♥♥♥ had only had to see the other 2 leaders die, he wasn’t going to let anybody die on the SS-SWAGAROONY.Fashion ♥♥♥ then stumbled across a town that sold boat items, and he got this thing called a captains seat. This is where things got worse. After this seat we still had around 3-4 thousand dollars left, so we sailed back to a level 2 towns in search for a tavern. And we found a tavern, and we got 3 new people. One, which is quite important, Shrek. Now I’m not saying this as a joke, the other 2 names were serious names and this one had a green shirt so fashion ♥♥♥ called him Shrek. But this person is very important. After these 3 new people things became...strange. And tbh the captains seat didn’t really do anything. But ah yes, this is when things became dodgy. The first sign on dodgyness was Fashion ♥♥♥ was becoming very depressed, and depended to be paid every 10 seconds or we would probably kill someone. But one day he didn’t get payed and just....snapped.Right after we destroyed a level 4 ship. He turned on everyone in the ship, and they were forced to fight back. Rave man then soon followed Fashion man, snapping and turning on everybody. Getting emotional again give me a minute.So they were 2 men down, and the beloved Fashion ♥♥♥ had finally died. Of course though, the next person in line was Abbo man, and he wanted change in the ship and no more incidents like this.Of course, the best solution was to buy 4 more irrelevant people and see what would happen, and guess what happened... well at this point nothing happened but were getting there.So Abbo man wanted to take over a ship because he just spent all of Fashion ♥♥♥♥ money. Everybody went onto the ship, Abbo man, party man, aghaghagh, Shrek, and everyone else that was still alive. They killed everybody in the ship then, it happened again, somebody turned.And guess who that somebody was. Abbo man. Abbo man turned on everybody, and then it lead to total disaster. Everybody turned, and there was only one person who was left in the end. ShrekWho was actually bleeding and died of blood loss 10 seconds after. The end.*All of this actually happened in Pixel Piracy. ** I was emotionally attached to almost every character in my ship *** I am now emotionally unstable'Do you recommend this game'?Well, I love the character part of things and the ships and battles and stuff. But its extremely glitchy for a full release, especially when there is lots of people on your boat. Another thing that started to happen was only the captain could move on the boat and everyone would start starving until I moved placesAnd of course, the moral of this story is that money is bad.

content:
Posted: January 21, 2015
												This is a fun little game that I think is well worth the money I paid for it.  The devs are responsive and the community is active.  Lots to recommend it.  I don't see myself going back to playing it again any time soon, however.  I like the current crop of rogue-likes quite a lot, permadeath and ridiculous difficulties are great with me.  My problem, though, is that I've run into three game-breaking bugs in the dozen or so hours that I've played it and at least one of them went away when I provided my save file to the devs.  They loaded it up, couldn't see the bug, gave me back the save and when I loaded up the one they gave me back I didn't see the bug either. These are the three I've hit:- my captain got 'stuck' trying to climb back aboard my ship when leaving an island.  I couldn't make him move back or foward, so I quit.  When I restarted the game I would get one second of activity before "Game Over" because my captain had fallen in the water and drowned.- my captain got 'stuck' on the far side of an island and couldn't move back through the various shops to the ship.  Even after reloading the game.- during a combat three of my crew fell off the island into the water and drowned.  As the game clearly states it does not save during combat, I reloaded the last save.  Which seemed to have happened immediately after the three crew members had drowned, a second before.The game is fun.  Make no mistake.  And usually your game will end the way any rogue-like ends, you'll die because some fight went against you because you under-estimated your opponent.  Occasionally, though, be prepared for the game itself to just smash your tower and make you start building over again.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												If you like pirates, like the ocean, like being able to put your ship together the way you want, like being able to hire your own crew, then you'll like this game.You start out with the captain, which is you, controlled by your left mouse, and one crew member who's controlled by right mouse, you could start with 2 with the right starting perks. Every pirate, including your captain, has a passive equipment slot for various items, a melee weapon slot, a ranged weapon slot, and statistics. Strength, determines melee damage. Vitality,  determines max health, armor, movement speed, and health regen, Intelligence, determines how much extra experience your pirate gains from everything. Dexterity, determines ranged weapon accuracy, and damage. Agility, determines movement speed, and attack speed. Luck, determines your critical hit chance. The adventure starts at a level 1 town, with all the stores. Town's have different levels, I do not know the range yet, but I've seen it go up to 4, and this level determines whether they sell stronger, more useful items or not. Throughout the ocean you will encounter other pirate ships, you can either try to avoid them, or you can engage them in combat, fire cannons at their ship, or board it. When you win an engagement boaring the enemy ship, your pirates get experience, gold from their kills and sometimes enemies drop weapons or special items. You get the choice of whether to take over the ship and abandon your last one, or plunder it, gaining lots of gold, and a few ship parts. There's far more to the game than I say here, but these are the basics. I'd recommend getting this game, it's a great game, and you'll have fun, as well as a fine way to pass time, if this is in your library!

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 18, 2014
												This game is more than what comes to the eye.Core Mechanics: You are a pirate. Your job is to aquire crew, bigger ships, money for food and items, and once strong enough to take on the great pirate overlords.-The world is randomly generated-Different pirates can be hired and given different abilities-Managing your crew breaks down to thier moral, hunger, and payment for service.-Build bigger ships with ship parts or simply plunder ones you take from enemies.-Upradealbe characters that can be given skills, gear, and form bonds with the player.-Fight the war on hunger, saddness, betrayal, the plague, and the savages and locals of the sea.Visuals/audio: The game takes your random characters and has them wobble about as they move around. Its simple, but pretty unique and adorable. The pixel graphics are well done, even if they try to use as few as possible for "effect". The animations are simple aswell, yet attacks have great nockback, sound effects from pistols and swords are oddly satisfying, and the little voices the pirates yell constantly gives them an aditional form of character.In the end, the game is a roguelike pirate managing adventure that becomes highly addictive and even if you fail you not only get a chance to try again in that instance, but next adventure you are smarter, more aware of how these seas work.The game was co-created by Re-Logic, the creators of Terraria. So I had fairly standard expectations. I was not dissapointed. This game is something fun to love and passes for a more simple, but satisfying rouge like pirate adventure.Happy Sailing mates.

When I want a person on my crew to go do something I should be able to quickly click the person and then click what I want it to do. I am not going to give up on this game. content:
Posted: June 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								I've had this game for less than a week, and I've already pumped 24 hours into it. I've stayed up until 4 AM two nights in a row because I've been playing this game. It's really fun and really addicting.It has a bit of a learning curve. I had to play three or four games in order to actually get the hang of it. It can get really hard at points, and these points may cause a bunch of save-scumming. The game is also still in Early Access mode right now, so there are still a few bugs that need to be touched up and updates that need to happen. All in all, though, Pixel Piracy is incredibly fun, and I'd recommend it to anyone.

content:
Posted: August 18, 2014
												honestly i dont know where to start with this game, for the first few hours you will probably have the most fun, running around, killing things, capturing animals and plundering ships, and all your crew will do their jobs and you wont pay an arm and a leg, then you get far(like i have) and have a crew of 5, and im only level 75, but after one fight(about 5 minutes of gameplay) i owe like 300 gold for just their salaries... how the hell am i gunna make money that way? then they stopped doing their skills!!! what the hell am i paying the crew for? they dont cook, no one cleans(even though we all have that skill) and we are starving to death but they refuse to cook! the ship is damaged and none of the crew i have stated for repairs will even lift a finger to fix it! then between the random suicides of falling off the ship, to overpowered enemies with high knockback, its a wonder how this game got so faras it is! i see very high hopes, but a lot of much much MUCH needed work. many issues with fps staying up, for some reason it slows down and starts to lag at random intervals to the point where the game is almost unplayable, and it hasnt happened to just me either! please start making huge updates, and the content is ok, but half the people dont know how to obtain the items, hell, i dont even know how to obtain all the items, some say they come from chests, which chests? ship chests or island ones? and i killed a legendary boss but got no special drops. also ranging in this gamme is a very hard build... why do i always have to have a mele weapon, but cant choose just a ranged one? i wanted to use only pistols, but thats impossible. and they are so slow, but they can be very powerful. i like the pet system, i used monkeys and spiders, both of which gain hp for each level, turtles dont gain hit points, and parrots... the only way for me to obtain a parrot is if i catch it, and choose to keep the ship it was on, it never mounts me(or anyone in the crew) to leave the ship! so i usually kill them. my men also have issues climbing over blocks, and sometimes dont listen when i click and tell them to go anywhere. i also dont know how factions work... i go online and see people can have an encounter that isnt hostile... but im level 75 and done plenty of missions, and killed a legendary and still dont get anything other than hostile ship interceptions. this game is fun though when it doesnt bug, i hope they make it possible to duel weild(double mele or double ranged) or allow me to be fully ranged to stay at a distance. and i hope to see them fix the morale issues like, at once. and obviously the issues of crew doing nothing at all, really annoys me. this game has a ton of potential, but they need to fix the issues before they start putting in customizeations. but id love to see more customizations when the bugs are fixed, colors to ships, textures, maybe even different wood,  hopefully you will allow us to pic the size of our sails? that would be awesome. but please fix the bugs, makes me kinda regret buying the game now instead of waiting=\

content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
												I basically played this game straight through. The first ten minutes had me doubting but soon I was HOOKED ( GET IT???!?!)In all seriousness this game is charming, addictive, and it doesnt take itself to seriously. If you purchase it on sale for $0.99 then you really cannot go wrong. If you like the idea of becoming a PIRATE LORD from the ground up then please give this one a go. I havent had as much fun with a pixelated game since terraria...GEE I WONDER WHY?Its basically a pixelated rpg focused on encountering enemy ships and randomized islands. There is not a lot of variance with either but thats okay since your not looking for a triple A title here. The funnest part for me was crafting my own ship design and training my L33T crew of adorable blood thirsty mini-pirates.Yes/10

												This charming game is a heck of a lot of fun when you get into it, it does have some flaws which mean i probably won't be returning to play the game now i have "beaten" it and killed the 4 pirate lords. A few changes i would love to see includeBetter controlling of crew/Better AI - I'm talking about pathfinding and also i would love to have a little "fire the cannons!" button, to controll when my gunners are firing and perhaps even the ability to assign a cannon to a particular gunner.reworked cleaning process, by the end of my playthrough i have about 5 or 6 wedges of poo stuck in my ship which i can't remove because the rules of the game dictate you cannot remove a block if a piece of poo is near that block. My suggestion for at least a quick fix for now is having a boat washing shop on the town islands that will clean all current poo off your ship.Framerates - Sometimes the game just dramatically drops in frames, most of the time i'm at 60 but sometimes it really starts to drop and the only way to fix it is by restarting the game, i'm not an expert in these types of things but isn't that a memory leak or something?you canr really tell alot of love has gone into this game and I feel the price of the game is right for what you are getting so i deffinitly would reccomend this game! :D

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 4, 2015
												Controls are a mess, menus are atrocious. Customization is almost exclusively random. Music is non-existent. Sounds are annoying. The tutorial and in-game descriptions are riddled with typos and spelling mistakes. Combat is... clunky at best.Given that this is supposedly from the creators of Terraria.The concept is great and the foundations are there, but the developers seem to have not done anything with them. I have played this game pre-release, and I have to say there has to be something horribly wrong with the game if it's actually worse in its current state than when I first played it, a year ago, or two.I would have expected a product that compares to or exceeds Terraria in quality, instead of feeling like what a 10-year-old would have made after an afternoon of messing around in Game Maker. I get the feeling that someone's top priority was to push out a game ASAP and make quick money instead of producing a game that will stay relevant for years.3/10, would not recommend even if you can get it for free.

content:
Posted: June 22, 2014
Early Access Review
								At first, the game seemed fine. After all, you could sail the seas and plunder the hell out of everywhere, which was supposed to be fun, right?Then, I started to get annoyed by the poop. The sight of poop and the sound of poop every ten seconds is really annoynig and it gets even worse if you have a large crew. And the game becomes boring and repetitive even before buying cannons. And the story is also repetitive even at the first hour. Attack islands, kill the treasure guards, loot the chest. Attack ships, loot the treasure, plunder them if you manage to not sink them if you have cannons. Or if you are really high level, attack towns and take the gold. Nothing else, except for the events which are either you getting exp or crew wanting money.The graphics are at the level of some basic flash game but is too resource heavy for non-gaming computers, which is why I bought this at the first place. And mind you, it can run games (at low specs) like Minecraft, M&B, Bioshock etc.  smoothly but not this. So don't buy this thinking it is easy to run.The combat is also too boring. It is essentially random and also stupid: a turtle or a chicken can deal more damage than a sword...And it gets frustrating when the guy kicking the endless stream of poop every second with the worst algorithm I've ever seen (instead of cleaning the nearest poop, it goes for a random one) and the sound... god...It is funny in a silly way at the first couple of hours but gets incredibly annoying with the repeating sounds (poop+kick) and places and missions.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 10, 2014
Early Access Review
								Played this on PC for a while, was amused but the game is more broken than fun. Now returning after updates I find that it is less broken, but also absurdly less fun. Let us review..The difficulty of this game shifts wildly from easy to the point of boredom to how-the-hell-am-I-supposed-to-do-anything. Often times this shift doesn't even require you to begin a new game, rather you just have a small stroke of bad luck and suddenly ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t abounds. The easiest example of this are the islands that are everywhere. You explore them at the beginning and find but a few enemies, if you're lucky they are pirates with similar health and weapons, luckier still its just a group of monkies with a chest. Those are not typical encounters. Rather the vast majority of the time you will find the island literally infested with more enemies than you have crew, each with better weapons than you can buy, and each indivudually having more health than your entire crew combined. That's not a challenge, that's locking off an entire section of the game. Ok, you might think to yourself, I guess I can come back later with more pirates/weapons/skills/etc and do this. You can, but only for those islands that you have explored and thus locked down their difficulty. The more you grow your crew the more the absurd scale of the island difficulty tries to be vertical. I'm at the point where I effectively ignore them unless I feel like watching my crew get slaughtered by BOARS.Now with a signifigant portion of the game rendered effectively gone lets address the pirate ships. Those are definitely fun...for a while...which is to say up until danger level 4. Once the idiots start getting cannons it become an exercise in frustration as you bumrush the cannoneers to stop them from blowing up and sinking their own ship and killing everyone. You would think that those who carry explosives aboard their ships would provide more than a single layer of wood between them and a watery death. This also raises serious questions about the usefulness of cannons aboard your own ship, since a few shots from you might cause the same destruction leaving you with nothing for your troubles except some debt since you now need more cannonballs. That's fun.OH, I almost forgot about the AI, though intelligence is rather a strong term for what I've seen my pirates do. Lets say you're going to try and be tricky to take an island you explored that has less than 15 enemies with 300 health that hit for 20+ damage. You notice they are spread out and figure you can mob them individually without losing everyone. So you land, you drag the attack icon to a guy and watch as everyone proceeds to sprint past them and die...Ok reload and try again, maybe you misclicked or something. Nope, attack icon doesn't seem to actually direct anyone...right click? Nope. Hrm... I should also mention that getting all of your pirates to actually do anything is a miracle in itself. I can't count the number of times I've ordered my men to board a ship only to find that 3-4 just decided "Nah" and are hanging around my ship causing unnecessary losses. Even better should you spam right click to get the lazy buggers over there it is entirely possible that a few of your pirates already on the enemy ship decide that your orders mean they should go back home. Now since new targets have opened up some of your own pirates may gleefully decide to run the gauntlet of every other enemy on the ship and die. There seem to be new features being added, which is good, like the bounty/wanted boards...buuut you can't seem to put them off until later? Yeah sure my and my one other crewmate will go after this dude, that makes sense. If you tell it to♥♥♥♥♥♥off, like you probably will 99.99% of the time, then it mocks you and will never activate again.Don't even get me started on the voices...for the love of god the voices. I would rather they not even be there instead of listening to the same damn line over...and over...every time I take an action or just because they happen to be talking to the crew. ♥♥♥♥ hearing my captain say "Loser" or "Land HO" about 2000 times just makes me turn the sound off entirely. That's disappointing because the sound is actually pretty good.I keep coming back to this game because it seems like it should be fun, and playing drunk is pretty great, but I always leave frusterated and annoyed that I wasted time and money on this.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 29, 2015
												So I've decided to write a short review for those of you deciding on whether or not this title is for you. Let me clarify; it's not for everyone. This game is a lot of exploration, repeditive battles, and also has an exhaling amount of frusteration if you so choose to play on the more difficult settings. However this game is a well built "simulation". It provides fun and relaxing moods with some very beautfiul water settings and also islands. You have the ability to build and customize ships to your liking, hire an abundent amount of crew, play "pokemon" and catch animals in cages, and also plunder and must your way through pirates, colonials, and islanders. Overall this game is a work of art, I recommend it to those of you who want something to do for a couple hours at a time. Like I said it's not for everyone and even myself (Particuallry liking this game) can't play it for more than couple hours at a time. That being said you will enjoy it, and if achievements are your thing than this game has serveral easy ones. Not to mention the steam trading cards are fairley cheap as well. So in the end, yes Pixal Piracy is a great game and you should definately check it out.

content:
Posted: May 5, 2014
Early Access Review
								Pixel Piracy is a pretty damng cool game. Nothing like it is currently on the market. Youre at the mercy of RNG (random number generator) a lot of the time, but its done well enough to where its not too obvious. Customization has gotten much better over the last year ive had this game. Truthfully I play it for a week straight, then run into issues or bugs, and I put it down for a month. Those issues, plus new content, are then fixed/added. Feels almost like a new game each time. However there hasnt been a build of the game ive played without at least one HUGE issue. I think the game is over priced at 15$, I got it for 5$ and im positively happy with having got my money's worth.

As it is, there's just a maze of menus that I don't enjoy navigating to select a bunch of complicated options that don't seem to change anything.Picked this up on sale, and I doubt I'll play it again.The promo materials look a lot more interesting than the game feels.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 24, 2015
												I love pirate themed games more so than the average guy, I bought Pixel Piracy over 6 months ago and loved it initially. I knew of several bugs that made the game difficult, so I decided to wait until it was properly done.The game has now been properly released and I've played about 20 minutes before I encountered a few game breaking bugs.My captain would sail endlessly without getting to the desired location and continiously level up, the menu wouldnt pop up to escape and I had to terminate the program (attempts to play on the same save made the bug recur, which is a pain if you're far into the game).I didnt care at first and simply made a new save, but then I encountered a bug that was common when the game was still in early access, the pirates wouldnt use their skills and poop would cover the ship. This would lower moral and eventually lead the crew to mutiny (unless you changed ships constantly and paid your crew). There are a few more bugs i wont mention, but they still caused quite a bit of frustration and heartache when trying to fix or work around them.I loved this game, I really did. However after encountering so many bugs I have grown to hate it. I'd only reccomend this game if it was on sale and not at full price

content:
Posted: April 3, 2015
												This game has been out for 2 years and still has the most obnoxious bugs in it. The concept of pixel piracy was a fantastic idea, but the game seems like it was abandoned by the developers. Imagine spending 4+ hours on your captain then having him drop ♥♥♥♥ing dead for no ♥♥♥♥ing reason at at all. I stayed up until 5am on my first captain and he  made it all the way to level 11 when his health randomly started to ♥♥♥♥ing deteriorate. I checked his stats; he wasn't bleeding, he wasn't hungry, nor was he sick. He just dropped ♥♥♥♥ing dead. The bugs have made it unplayable; crew dying at random, crew ignores my frequent attempts to get them to fish for food and decides to ♥♥♥♥ing practice sword fighting with a fishing rod instead, random lagspikes when you call your crew from a town, etc. The devs need to get off their asses and polish this almost perfect game. Until these bugs are fixed, you shouldn't consider buying this product.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 20, 2014
												Now that this game has been released, I can write this review for a released game.While I was playing in the beta, I saw a lot of potential for this game.  It seemed almost like the Sims, with pirates and swashbuckling and all the greatness you want from piracy.  You can recruit your crew and equip each member with weapons and skills to make your pirate crew a fearesome force on the open seas.That being said, the implementation is far from perfect.  A lot of the tooltips seem off point, like the training swords that you can get to put on your ship state "Training is for the weak".  Until you actually buy them, you don't actually realize this is a part for your ship that allows your crew member to gain XP.  Town notations have messed up spacing.  Many items' functionality is left unknown to the player until they actually use it, which is awful considering that everything is the game feels very expensive (at least in the beginning).The biggest issue I have with the game is the AI.  I was constantly fighting the AI with what it wanted to do against what I needed to do (or it needed to do, for that matter).  For example, I had a fisher on my crew, who should be providing fish for the crew to eat.  Instead, the AI wants him to go to the training swords and gain XP.  Every time I try to take him off the training swords, he takes two steps off the swords, then goes right back to them.  Meanwhile, my crew is starving (and dying).  My Captain, starving, prefers to stay at the training swords instead of eat, so then he dies.  In combat, I try to remove heavily wounded crew members from the enemy, but they take a few steps away and attempt to attack again.This game had a lot of good ideas and I wanted to be an awesome pirate captain, but I spent most of my time fighting the AI that should be making my experience more fluid and playing "guess its purpose" on every item I found and/or bought.  Note to the developer(s): if you are having trouble making something automatic, leave it to the player, and only automate it when you know with 99% certainty that the palyer will want it.  For example, if a pirate is starving, go eat.  If the player has to send the pirate to the training swords manually, it is better than removing the control from the player.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
												I will rate this game based on the following things:Art/GraphicsMusic/SoundContentMechanicsUpdatesArt/Graphics - 4/10What you're looking at onscreen isn't always clear as the pixelated art is very blurry. The style of art doesn't fit the feel of the game as it feels very weird. You cannot zoom in either to see what's going on more clearly.Music/Sound - 3/10There isn't much many sound effects and if there are, they are drowned out by the music. The music is pirate themed, but there's only one track and it gets very annoying very quickly. The music is not very good, either, in my opinion.Content - 1/10There are only 3 types of places to go and that's it. It may be open world, but every place you go to is pretty much identical to some other place you've visited. A lot of the time you're playing the game, you're waiting for 2 minutes to go to the next location.Mechanics - 2/10The mechanics never change from the beginning of the game. Fighting other ships is boring and land combat is exactly the same. Nothing new happens as you progress except that you get more materials to build your ship and more crew members. But with those things, you're still doing everything you did when you started out, but on a larger scale.Updates - 2/10The Steam page says that there is constant updates, but the updates aren't constant and they mostly consist of a few bug fixes. However, there is a couple of tiny content additions every so often.Total - 24/100The developers have given up on this and it was released was to early. It is extremely unpolished.

												I hired a crew member and took an emeny ship. While trying to figure out how to plunder it I first picked up my other crew member, and when I put him down he jumped overboard and drowned.Apparently pirates can't swim.Still not seeing any way to plunder it I returned to my own ship thinking maybe it was automatic. When I tried to sail on the game warned me that I hadn't plundered or captured the enemy ship, so I tried to board it again, then spotted the plunder button was now enabled so I clicked it.Well, the enemy ship exploded while my captain was mid-flight between my ship and the enemy ship, and without anything to land on he just kept flying... He's dead now.R.I.P. Captain DarkStarSwordNot a great first impression - the game definitely needs more polish. It might get better further in, but my attention span is too short for that. On the positive side I'm loving the sound track :)

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 20, 2014
												Now that this game has been released, I can write this review for a released game.While I was playing in the beta, I saw a lot of potential for this game.  It seemed almost like the Sims, with pirates and swashbuckling and all the greatness you want from piracy.  You can recruit your crew and equip each member with weapons and skills to make your pirate crew a fearesome force on the open seas.That being said, the implementation is far from perfect.  A lot of the tooltips seem off point, like the training swords that you can get to put on your ship state "Training is for the weak".  Until you actually buy them, you don't actually realize this is a part for your ship that allows your crew member to gain XP.  Town notations have messed up spacing.  Many items' functionality is left unknown to the player until they actually use it, which is awful considering that everything is the game feels very expensive (at least in the beginning).The biggest issue I have with the game is the AI.  I was constantly fighting the AI with what it wanted to do against what I needed to do (or it needed to do, for that matter).  For example, I had a fisher on my crew, who should be providing fish for the crew to eat.  Instead, the AI wants him to go to the training swords and gain XP.  Every time I try to take him off the training swords, he takes two steps off the swords, then goes right back to them.  Meanwhile, my crew is starving (and dying).  My Captain, starving, prefers to stay at the training swords instead of eat, so then he dies.  In combat, I try to remove heavily wounded crew members from the enemy, but they take a few steps away and attempt to attack again.This game had a lot of good ideas and I wanted to be an awesome pirate captain, but I spent most of my time fighting the AI that should be making my experience more fluid and playing "guess its purpose" on every item I found and/or bought.  Note to the developer(s): if you are having trouble making something automatic, leave it to the player, and only automate it when you know with 99% certainty that the palyer will want it.  For example, if a pirate is starving, go eat.  If the player has to send the pirate to the training swords manually, it is better than removing the control from the player.

												I feel like I gave this game a good chance to wow me, as I played it for a little more than an hour. But in that hour I felt like I saw everything that Pixel Piracy had to offer. The clunky menu, unintuitive skill system, and lackluster tutorial all combined to form a game that I struggled to enjoy. If you absolutely have to see this game for yourself, I would recommend buying this on sale. I had my doubts about this game after seeing a youtuber play it, but I wanted to give it a fair chance. I suggest that if you have any doubts or misgivings about this game, then trust your hunch and give this one a pass.

Posted: April 24, 2015
												I love pirate themed games more so than the average guy, I bought Pixel Piracy over 6 months ago and loved it initially. I knew of several bugs that made the game difficult, so I decided to wait until it was properly done.The game has now been properly released and I've played about 20 minutes before I encountered a few game breaking bugs.My captain would sail endlessly without getting to the desired location and continiously level up, the menu wouldnt pop up to escape and I had to terminate the program (attempts to play on the same save made the bug recur, which is a pain if you're far into the game).I didnt care at first and simply made a new save, but then I encountered a bug that was common when the game was still in early access, the pirates wouldnt use their skills and poop would cover the ship. This would lower moral and eventually lead the crew to mutiny (unless you changed ships constantly and paid your crew). There are a few more bugs i wont mention, but they still caused quite a bit of frustration and heartache when trying to fix or work around them.I loved this game, I really did. However after encountering so many bugs I have grown to hate it. I'd only reccomend this game if it was on sale and not at full price

content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
												I will rate this game based on the following things:Art/GraphicsMusic/SoundContentMechanicsUpdatesArt/Graphics - 4/10What you're looking at onscreen isn't always clear as the pixelated art is very blurry. The style of art doesn't fit the feel of the game as it feels very weird. You cannot zoom in either to see what's going on more clearly.Music/Sound - 3/10There isn't much many sound effects and if there are, they are drowned out by the music. The music is pirate themed, but there's only one track and it gets very annoying very quickly. The music is not very good, either, in my opinion.Content - 1/10There are only 3 types of places to go and that's it. It may be open world, but every place you go to is pretty much identical to some other place you've visited. A lot of the time you're playing the game, you're waiting for 2 minutes to go to the next location.Mechanics - 2/10The mechanics never change from the beginning of the game. Fighting other ships is boring and land combat is exactly the same. Nothing new happens as you progress except that you get more materials to build your ship and more crew members. But with those things, you're still doing everything you did when you started out, but on a larger scale.Updates - 2/10The Steam page says that there is constant updates, but the updates aren't constant and they mostly consist of a few bug fixes. However, there is a couple of tiny content additions every so often.Total - 24/100The developers have given up on this and it was released was to early. It is extremely unpolished.

content:
Posted: January 22, 2015
												ARRR Here be a fine swashbucklin adventure. Full of twists and turns and sailors who cannot swim, even when their very lives depend on it.This game was painful to begin with. I died a lot.I found that you have to grind your way through so many ship encounters to get the resources required to get anywhere.My first boss fight was brutal, I watched each one of my sailors get butchered and die a painful bloody death.To avoid being out gunned and out matched try the following;-Start the game with long nights option.-Give your sailors fast learner.-Don't worry about poop on the deck during the early game, you can always capture somone elses ship.-Never use standard cannons, only swivel cannons.-Catch spiders as pets, they rock.-Pandas look cool, but they are rubbish as pets.-Never place your ammo on deck, or within four squares of something the enemy ships can hit.-Sell everything. I Have managed to grind my way through to completion once or twice. You get a sense of accomplishment when you mow down the final ship.

content:
Posted: January 28, 2015
												As far as the previous posts about glitches and whatnot, if you read whats been posted recently a massive update is being released on 1/29.After playing the game for this long the only problem that drives me nuts is after I gathered a crew of >12 for some reason when I would send them to battle another ship 2 or 3 of my mateys would sit on top of the enemies ship to be hit then knocked into the depts of the ocean to be baried with davey jones locker. Yes the crew likes to poop but if you give every member the perk/stat/attribute of "cleaning" then that problem goes away. If you think your wasting a slot, think again, each crew member has a lot of available slots to give upgrades to.The game is fun and simple, build a crew, build a ship, travel around, micromanage your people, upgrade, then rinse and repeat. What others find annoying I find a fun challange. Its not game breaking you just have to be more open to unusual challanges. Its excellent to play between classes as there is nothing that keeps you from quiting that doesnt take a few minutes at max.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 31, 2015
												VERY IN SHORT : Conditional Recommend! Ambitious game which disappoints with shallow mechanics, yet can still entertain! Buy on sale if you like its pirate concept!-----Pixel Piracy is a unique little game with many interesting ideas on board, but overall fails to deliver on most of them with sadly shallow game mechanics and a very clunky UI. However if the concept they are pitching appeals to you, it is not hard to sail through quite a few hours messing around building different ships and acquiring and training a crew into full blown battle-hardened pirates. There really is no other game that I know of which offers exactly what Vitali Kirpu and Alexander Poysky have dreamed up here. Indeed other pirate games exist on the market which do a lot of what Pixel Piracy does, and in most cases they do it better. However the ability to create your own ship from scratch, and hire individual crew members to man it into ship to ship battle, or an island raid alongside you certainly adds a certain charm to this game which sets it apart from the rest in the pirate genre. Unforunately the most endearing part of the game is marred by exactly what should enhance it. Exploration can be tedious as all islands look essentially the same, and contain little to nothing to do outside of fighting enemies. (Though there are towns, they aren't much better.) All in all I feel that this is a game that, had the developers put in a little more love and the necessary time to flesh out the existing mechanics and add a few new ones, could have been the next big indie game. Though as it stands it feels more like an Android or iOs game, I can only recommend one to pick it up while its on sail (yahar!), but only if you are a fan of the genre or the concepts on offer appeal to you.-----Note: I understand that although the game is technically 'released', they have hired someone who is currently working on Pixel Piracy updating and adding new content to the game. If my opinion changes based upon this, I will update this review.

												I got the game at a bundle for peanuts money and it wasnt great a first but after I played for a while i stoppedafter a month or two i played it again it was fun, the game is pretty simple and its not too challenging if you dont choose to take risks but i think its a fun game.in the game you pretty much hire pirates level them up give the ones you like some skills so they wont die and improve your ship over and over with cannos and decorations. the game is enjoyable on its own but you wont find yourself playing hours and hours to no end.  I like the art style or more correctly like the coloring and dont hate the art style which is sadly a good thing for indie games and not a normal thing. i give the game a thumb up because it costed me near to nothing it was like a bonus to a bunch of great games and i played about 10 hours of this and every so often i play a little more and it is still fun and enjoiable to me.P.S. its improtant to get poop cleaning mastery from a misk shop cause its the only way to clean poop, teach about one pirate every five pirates (and one early on)

content:
Posted: July 1, 2016
												Pixel Piracy is an Indie Pirate Simulator from the makers of Terraria. The game is a fun game to play when your bored. You create your own Captain and you create a crew by hiring people to help you on your journey. But be careful as you may come across enemy pirates wanting to steal your gold.The game also allows you to create your own Pirate Ship, which is always fun!Sadly, the game dosen't have as much content as I would of liked it too. You find yourself completely ignoring the objective given to you before you start your game. You just keep repeating the same stuff over and over again. But it dosen't stop it from being fun for the first few hours of the game.I do recommend you to get this game as it has a low price too. Fans of Terraria will probably not be disapointed!

Early Access Review
								At the current state of this game I would never ecommend wasting money on this game. It was so fun to play back before the broken update hit. I could move all my men to kill the enemy and it was such a nice combat style....now onto this update. You have to assign people to teams which half the time don't listen. The ship you have is the one you are stuck with. Only thing you can really do is modify it now. The plunder interaction is completely broken, you hit it and in a single instant you see all your hard work and your crew just disappear. Then the game says the amazing promise of any early access game "GAME OVER".

content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
												Pirates need to be potty trained.This game is quite fun, the graphics are a bit oversaturated for my taste but I loved it even when it was early access and had very few features, now that there's an end game I feel like I'm gonna be playing it a lot more.What it is: captaining a pirate crew, pillaging/looting other ships and islands and exploration. Nice concept and it's quirky and fun but like most rogue-like games the gameplay is rather reptitive so if you're not into these kinds of procedurally generated games you might not be into this. Remember to have your crew be far away from the edge of the ship you guys are getting onto, biggest reason behind deaths when I play is I attack before everyone is fully on the ship and they instantly get knocked out into the ocean for the sharks to devour.

content:
Posted: June 3, 2016
Jim if you take a dump on my ship one more time I will gut you openRemember when everyone had like, two coupons for this game?Me either.Pixel Piracy is a game where you take on the role of a pirate captain and his crew.It's also kinda trash.The game is pretty badly optimized and some design choices left a bad taste in my mouth. Like how opening the menu slows the music to a halt, or how the female crew members make male remarks, and are just a male voiceline set at a high pitch. Like, I could have this one crewmate of mine named Sallly Somethingorother, and she'll be talking about how she needs a woman.I'd be fine with that if the same thing wasn't being said by literally every other woman.I have serious questions about how repopulation works for these pirates now, if noone is interested in the men.The game is kinda fun I guess but only for a little while. Then you get dicked over because apparently you forgot there was a salary system in this game and a mutiny gets staged and all the while your ship is covered in crap.Overall I give it a skull and crossbones/[insert pirate reference followed by 'YarHarHar']

content:
Posted: March 8, 2015
												I have repeatedly tried to get into this game.  I've had it since early access.  After all this time it still feels like it could be one of those "New game every day" flash games.  It's just boring.  You would think without complex graphics they could add a little variety but every encounter looks exactly the same.  There is also no strategy.  Just go to the next closest location and one click will move the entire crew from ship to shore (or other ship) where they kill everything without any guidance.  And the icing on the cake is that your entire crew can be killed by walking by a spikey bush!  Forget the enemies, that bush is a killer!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 26, 2016
												Pixel Piracy is a pirate simulator game where you control a group of pirates doing what pirates do best, that is plundering and picking fights with people (and animal). You start out with a captain and you choose what type of adventure you're going and manage your crew and finance as you sail to the path of gold and glory. A fun pirate simulator, pirate battles is exciting especially in the bigger ones where you can fire cannons and knock enemies overboard and see them descent the blue abyss below.One of my issues with this game is that it doesn't offer intuitive mechanics. When I first bought this game, it has absolutely nothing that teach me how to do stuff. But now it has tutorials and an in-game help despite some features (like capturing animals and bring them on board) is still not explained. I'll give it a pass for now and give kudos to the devs for fixing the game and keeping it updated.The main problem for me was this game has an incorrectly implemented difficulty progression. No, I don't mean the actual difficulty level you start the game with, but the "danger level" of pirate encounters. So the game wants you to defeat 4 (four) Legendary Pirates (referred as LP from now on). Instead of maxing out the danger level of all LPs, what the devs should've done is to scale up the difficulty (i.e danger level) once you defeat an LP and keep scaling up until you face the final LP. When I was playing and I defeated my first LP, I felt like that I "was too good at this" and it ultimately leads to me feeling that the game drags on unnecessarily long. Once you defeat an LP, you have to literally travel across the entire map for the next closest LP and defeat him, which was no problem except that you will get dozens of pirate encounters that felt like more of a bother rather than a threat. Then I played in another difficulties to see if the gameplay will be different, but I still encounter that plateau where I'm virtually invincible once I'd be able to defeat LP. I don't even know if the difficulty levels changed anything except slightly buffed enemies, more encounter, and marked up shop item prices. I think this bit needs major rework. Finishing the game by defeating three other LP is more of a chore than a challenge.Final thoughts, give it a try if you will, but for me it was fun until it became an absolute bore.
